description: The acronym H.O.L.Y. has a double meaning revealed by the line in the chorus, “high on loving you.”  The song is the first single to be released from their album Dig Your Roots, released on August 26, 2016.  https://twitter.com/FLAGALine/status/726016811465117698        This song was written by William Wiik Larsen, Nate Cyphert, and Mike Busbee, a.k.a. busbee—he’s also written for country artists like Garth Brooks and Rascal Flatts.  Florida Georgia Line rejected this song at first—they didn’t even listen to it all the way through. Singer Tyler Hubbard told ABC Radio: “A couple weeks later, we just were both kind of like, ‘Have you been listening to that “H.O.L.Y.,” that song?’ We both kind of fell in love with it over those few weeks of living with it, and realized the power. Sometimes a song doesn’t hit you right away.”  This song nearly went to an unbeliebable artist. busbee told Rolling Stone: “There was talk of Justin Bieber doing the song, and we had actually recorded it with another artist. Word came out that FGL were really into it—honestly we would’ve never thought to pitch that to them. We wrote it in L.A.; the other two writers are pop writers predominantly.”  Hubbard and his partner in Florida Georgia Line, singer Brian Kelley, were advised by their non-musical partners to do this song. Hubbard told Billboard: “There were three instances where our wives asked us about ‘H.O.L.Y.,’ and when we said we were considering it for FGL, they said we had to cut it. We feel like the song is anointed.”  On the Storme Warren Show, Kelley pointed out this song’s religious vibe. “It’s a beautiful, love, kind of spiritual, kind of worship song. The title of our album and tour is called ‘Dig Your Roots.’ For Tyler and I, there’s nothing more genuine and real and diggin’ our roots than singin’ a love song that sounds kind of like a worship song.”  This song crushed it on the charts—it rose to #1 on Hot Country Songs and #14 on the Hot 100.

description: “Cruise” is a song recorded by American country music duo Florida Georgia Line. It was released in August 2012 as the first single from their extended play It'z Just What We Do.  It was written by group members Brian Kelley and Tyler Hubbard with Joey Moi, Chase Rice, and Jesse Rice.  It was included on their debut studio album for Republic Nashville, Here’s to the Good Times, which was released on December 4, 2012.  By April 2013, “Cruise” had become the best-selling song by a country duo in digital history.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8PvebsWcpto

The FL-GA boys tell you how they like to have a good time with a little backing from another Georgia boy, Luke Bryan.  The official video also features a cameo from Travis Pastrana and his Nitro Circus.

description: “Heather” is the tenth track of Conan Gray’s debut album, Kid Krow. Conan previously mentioned “Heather” multiple times in tweets, including one saying: https://twitter.com/conangray/status/1225581862254284800  The album was first teased on January 5th on twitter and the tracklist including 12 songs, 4 of which were already released, was announced 5 days later.  Conan said that the song is about unrequited love. The song talks about Conan being in love with someone who is in love with Heather. He talks about frustration and jealously and how he has a love/hate relationship with Heather, wanting to be her. Conan’s sweater could possibly be the one seen in his artwork for “Comfort Crowd” where he wears a red and white striped knitted sweater.  Conan also recently tweeted lyrics from “Heather” which went under the radar, with only a few dedicated fans asking about the suspicious tweet.

description: As explained by Conan Gray via MTV News, this upbeat bedroom pop banger is about people who send out rumors. More specifically, it was written “after getting a midnight drunk sob text from [his] ex.”  They’d been running all around town telling everyone that I was some freak who wouldn’t leave them alone when in reality, they were the freak, […] sending strange late-night texts and showing up at my shows unannounced.  The song was first teased by Conan in a Tweet when he revealed that “Maniac” is his favorite song off his debut album. The title of this track was also teased through a cryptic Twitter thread, giving out one letter at a time with the chance to let fans guess.  Six days before Halloween, the spooky-themed music video was released alongside the track. It’s starring Jessica Barden, an actress famous for her role as Alyssa in the Netflix series The End of the F*`ing World.  In the video, Conan and Jess are on the mission to fight off Jess' ex-boyfriends, maniacs, who have risen from the grave.

description: “Generation Why” is the first single from Conan Gray’s debut EP, Sunset Season. The song was announced on September 30th, 2018 via social media along with an 11-second teaser music video. Conan released the song and its music video on October 3rd, 2018.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=entVpj_IT6M  After being accepted into UCLA and moving to Los Angeles, Conan signed a record label deal with Republic Records, and like the rest of Sunset Season, Generation Why features an evolved style and greater level of production as a result.  The song talks about the living youth in the 21st century and all the misconceptions, stereotypes, and truths that have been associated with the generation.

description: Released on October 26, 2018 as the second single from his debut EP Sunset Season, “Crush Culture” portrays the dissonance Conan feels towards the culture of modern crushes, and addresses the delusions and dishonesty of adolescent romantic pining.  The teaser for “Crush Culture” was first released on October 24, 2018.

description: “The Story” is a more personal and slow-tempo single compared to radio-friendly singles like “Maniac” from Conan’s debut album, Kid Krow. The song tells the story of his life before getting recognized, as explained by himself during The Comfort Crowd Tour in Saint Louis:  It’s one of the ones that means more to me. […] I like to tell stories and this song is kind of a story about my life when it was before all of [my fame].  Since the song is so personal, Conan has expressed hesitation in releasing the song and putting it on his album. He wrote the song purely for himself, and played it for his friends, who convinced him to release it.  “The Story” uses a first-person and third-person storytelling technique to narrate the listeners through Conan’s childhood which he has summed up as “less than ideal” back in October 29, 2019, at The Comfort Crowd Tour.

description: “Idle Town” is a tribute to Gray’s hometown and high school memories. He announced the release of the song on Twitter and teased the lyrics before releasing it with a music video on March 19, 2017. It is his first song to be available on iTunes and Spotify.  This song makes a return on Gray’s debut EP, Sunset Season.

description: Released two days before his debut studio album, Kid Krow, dropped, “Wish You Were Sober” finds American singer-songwriter Conan Gray wishing that someone he is into will tell him that they like him — even when they’re sober. The song’s upbeat production is a stark contrast between it and the “The Story,” a track it was preceded by.  “Wish You Were Sober,” was first teased by Conan himself via social media on March 16, 2020, with a line from the song’s chorus as the photo’s caption. Its March 18th release date was then officially announced a day later, with the music video dropping two days later.  It is also worth mentioning that this is the fifth pre-released track from Kid Krow.

description: In “girls”, Norwegian musician girl in red expresses her sexuality and the conflicts that come from loving girls.  A snippet of the song was played during an Instagram live before it was released as a single on June 8th, 2018; a music video for the song was uploaded to her Youtube channel the same day.

description: “i wanna be your girlfriend” documents the sentiments that the title implies. The female narrator voice laments on her relationship with her friend; ‘Hannah,’ who she has seemingly fallen in love with but who is unaware of this. The song is a tender confessional for the persona who reveals the details of her unrequited love, further complicated by the stigma and lack of normalised awareness of homosexuality.  The description to the song on girl in red’s bandcamp is simply:  don’t fall in love with a straight girl

description: “we fell in love in october” is about girl in red and her relationship with another girl. The song is about how they fell in love during fall and Marie’s (girl in red’s) feelings toward her.  In an interview with The Fader, Marie states that there was a lot of drama between the two and that she struggled accepting her. After a while when everything began to settle in, she accepted her and created this song as a tribute.  This song is a prequel to girl in red’s “forget her”, which is about the two breaking up. “we fell in love in october” is girl in red’s most popular song on Spotify to date.

description: “Summer Depression” is a song released by Girl in Red, initially on Soundcloud, on 16 February 2018.  On the YouTube lyric video, she stated that she isn’t glorifying depression for “Aesthetic” and was just writing a song generated by her own feelings.

description: Serotonin is the first song off of girl in red’s debut album, if i could make it go quiet. Marie grapples with depressive episodes and her struggle with mental health, a common theme across her songs.  In an interview with Spotify, she notes her new style and experimenting with rapping:   The first song on the album, “Serotonin,” which is also a single out today, includes a collaboration with producer FINNEAS where you’ll be rapping. What was experimenting with this style like? Do you see yourself doing more of it?  I think so, because I thought it was really fun. That rapping thing was all coming from me. No one was like “Yo Marie, what if you try rapping, what if you, like, get on those trap beats?” So I definitely think I want to go a little bit into that direction, but in my own way. Like Ed Sheeran, he raps but like it’s still Ed Sheerhan [sic], you know what I mean?   This marks her first collaboration with producer and singer-songwriter FINNEAS.

description: “bad idea!” is the last song from girl in red’s debut album BEGINNINGS. It ties up the album with its many callbacks to previous songs. The song references “girls,” “say anything,” and “i need to be alone.”  girl in red sings about being consumed by another person. she regrets the casual sexual relationship she had because she can’t seem to get enough and is now haunted by the feelings.  She premiered the song at the French festival Rock en Seine on August 24th, 2019. The following day she announced via Instagram the song would be released on September 4th, 2019.

description: “Are You Bored Yet?” is Wallows' first-ever feature, a collaboration with singer-songwriter Clairo. The track is also the lead single for the trio’s debut LP Nothing Happens.  Wallows explained the track’s lyrical content to Clash Music:  Lyrically the song is about the idea of someone being bored with a relationship that you have been in for a while, and the fear that you or the other person is ready to move on.

description: The newest song of Wallow’s debut EP Spring EP, “These Days” questions the age-old: “is she into me?”  The track was written one night in the studio when Wallows were recording the EP, with Dylan explaining to Clash Music:  Originally it (Spring) was going to be a five-song EP but then Cole made a demo and we were like, dude what we need to add that. We decided to do it and wrote it that night in the studio.

description: “Pictures Of Girls” is the lead single of Wallow’s debut EP Spring and the band played this track for their TV debut on The Late Late Show with James Corden.  The song is very reminiscent of something The Strokes would play and frontman Dylan Minnette even expected immediate comparisons telling Paper:  The Strokes or bands like that are definitely within our blood. With “Pictures of Girls” that just came out, I expected the immediate comparisons to be The Strokes.

description: “Scrawny” was written whilst Wallows were in the studio recording their other songs from debut album Nothing Happens,  making it one of the newest songs of the collection. It is the second single off the LP.  The band explained the writing process:  We were just about to go on a two week break from recording, before another week or so to wrap things up. In those two weeks, we wrote “Scrawny” and recorded it when we came back. We wanted this to feel like a light-hearted moment on the record surrounded by some of the serious themes and wanted to make sure the music had the same feeling as well.

description: “Pleaser” is Wallow’s first release, which also announced the band’s new name. The track was released independently by the band and peaked at number 2 on Spotify’s United States Viral 50 playlist: https://www.instagram.com/p/BTFuzXpjhJv/

description: Braeden Lemasters wallows in his feelings in “1980s Horror Film,” after his crush, “Jaime” doesn’t reciprocate his feelings. The plot twist comes in the final Chorus when Jaime explains that she’s just “not that into guys.”  According to a fan who attended the band’s Phoenix show on March 20, 2019, Braeden explained that the 1980s film discussed in the track is Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers.  An alternate version of the track was released as a single on October of 2018, titled “1980s Horror Film II” which features some sonic differences to the original, but the lyrical content is the same.

description: “OK” is expected to be the lead single of Wallows' second studio album.  An acoustic version of the song was played in a VIP setting in Syracuse on 27th February, 2020. In their newsletter following its release, they described it as:  a song about insecurities in a relationship; having a hard time accepting something that feels “too good to be true”, but overall learning to embrace it and accept the love you’re receiving and focusing on returning it.“

description: “Coffee” is a light acoustic ballad written by and performed by beabadoobee. In it, Bea lightly touches on the themes of mental health, relationships, and how they play together. In a Vice profile piece, Bea mentions that this song was about her boyfriend, Søren:  It was about my boyfriend, Søren, because he has green eyes. It was about him—it’s the cringiest love song about me making coffee for him.  In an interview with Pigeons with Planes, Bea confirms that this is the first song that she’s written for the guitar.  In the same interview, she also says  I’ve realized I can’t play to a click. ‘Coffee’ is all over the place. The tempo is so wack.  Notably, “Coffee” was sampled on Powfu’s death bed (coffee for your head) in 2019, which was re-released in 2020.

description: “She Plays Bass” was written for Bea’s friend, Eliana, who plays bass in her band. Bea often talks about how important their friendship is to her. She told Dazed about when they met:  We just couldn’t stop talking. We got about 20 tattoos in two months. We were obsessed with each other.

description: “Tired” is about the stressed and scattered brain of every human out there. It’s about that era, that period, that moment in time we all go through where everything seems pointless and you feel like you’re drowning in an endless pit.

song_name: I Wish I Was Stephen Malkmus

description: Bea’s tribute to her longtime fav, Stephen Malkmus, the lead singer of the 90’s indie band Pavement. It also describes her newfound fame and image change.    She eventually got to play him the song in person and she described the experience to DIY:  He’s one of my idols so that was insane. My manager was like, ‘You’ve got a visitor’ and I see the back of his head and I’m like, ‘Fuck, that’s him’. And then he went for a handshake and I just hugged him. We invited him on our tour bus and I was just staring at him like, ‘Oh my god, this is insane.’ I got to dedicate ‘I Wish I Was Stephen Malkmus’ to Stephen Malkmus!

description: This song is about reflecting on a once-happy relationship that has now lost the love it once had – Bea wonders and wants for the love she and this person used to have that has now ‘disappeared’.

description: Break My Heart Again is the third single from FINNEAS' debut album. It premiered in Zane Lowe’s Show on Apple Music’s Beats 1 radio station on February 20th, 2018.  The track was written and produced by FINNEAS himself. The lyrics revolve around the feeling of disconnect in a relationship. FINNEAS told Lowe:  To me it was just this really really personal illustration, and I think everything in the song happens to be true, I don’t sacrifice a good lyric because it’s not true, but in this case it is.  He has also shared with Du Jour that  The lyrics in the verses are basically verbatim text conversations I had with an ex-girlfriend. I thought it’d be cool to double illustrate that point so I added text and typing sounds to the production.

description: “Let’s Fall in Love for the Night” is FINNEAS' tenth solo single to be released, and the last of two singles to be released by the singer over the course of two weeks in October 2018.  The track is one of the singer’s most “classical pop” songs yet, as acknowledged by the singer in an interview with Billboard:  I love pop songs so much and I don’t put a ton of pressure on myself as a solo artist to always write the most commercial feeling thing, I just want to write things I would love to listen to. This feels like one of those.  In the same interview, the singer and songwriter also shared his inspiration for this song, which came in August of 2018, when he was in Osaka, Japan touring with his sister, rising artist Billie Eilish:  I was in Osaka, Japan, FaceTiming a girl I’d never met every day and knowing there was nothing I could really do about it. I wrote this song about the day I would fantasize having with her.  Its release was first teased in a tweet on October, 10, 2018: https://twitter.com/FinneasOConnell/status/1050066238859239424

description: An acoustic and inspirational song, “What They’ll Say About Us” is Finneas’s first single of 2020. The song is expected to be included on his album of the same year. Finneas teased the song the day before its release on Instagram. It came out during a time of unrest in the United States and speaks of a brighter future.

description: A piano-led ballad, “Angel,” is a timeless love song which debuted June 11 on the Beats 1 show on Apple Music. Finneas hinted in an Instagram caption that the song was written about his current girlfriend, Claudia Sulewski:  My song “Angel” is out now everywhere you like to listen to music ♥️ special thanks to Beats 1 for making it their World Record, Avis for designing the typeface, John Greenham for mastering, Rob Kinelski for mixing and to Claudia for being the best thing that’s ever happened to me and without whom this song and this image would not exist in any way  The song follows the release of Finneas'  “I Lost A Friend” and “Claudia”, both of which were well received and highly praised.  Describing his new song, Finneas said:  It’s got this kind of retro, synthy, drum delay vibe that reminded me of Beach House and Mac DeMarco. It was a feeling in a recording that I had never gotten to explore and I was just really excited to go there.  Finneas revealed during the Beats 1 preview that he plans on releasing many more singles in the coming months and that the music video for “Angel” would be coming “really soon.”

description: “What a Beautiful Name” is a song by Australian praise and worship group Hillsong Worship. The song, written and led by Brooke Ligertwood and co-written with Ben Fielding, refers to the promise of salvation through Jesus Christ as represented by His Holy Name. The “genre-smashing single” contributed to Hillsong being named Billboard’s Top Christian Artist of 2017. “What a Beautiful Name” won two Dove Awards for Song of the Year and Worship Song of the Year in 2017. It won the 2018 Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Christian Music Performance/Song. “What a Beautiful Name” was released on 6 January 2017, as the lead single from their 25th live album, Let There Be Light (2016).

description: “Who You Say I Am” is a song of thanksgiving for how God has created us. Our negative emotions and the words of the enemy can attack our self-images with lies. Songs like this and Bethel’s “No Longer Slaves” remind us of the biblical truth that sets us free from condemnation and fear.  It was released 3/2/2018 as a downloadable song when pre-ordering the album There Is More.

description: There are actually two songs named “King of Kings” released by Hillsong Worship. The first was written by Geoff Bullock for the 1995 Friends In High Places album when Hillsong Worship was called Hillsong Live and the most recent is this song here, written by Brooke and Scott Ligertwood. The song was first released on Hillsong Church’s Youtube and Facebook livestream on Sunday the 14th of April, 2019. It was formally released as a single on July 12, 2019.

description: In the third song of  No Other Name, Hillsong Worship displays God’s ability to heal and mend the broken as well as His sacrificial nature. The artist uses an analogy of a jar of clay and broken pieces to drive the point home. The Chorus includes a cover of the Hymn, Amazing Grace which presents the wonderful nature God’s love.

description: “Beautiful Crazy” is love song about different reasons why he likes a girl. Taste of Country describes the song as “a slow, personal love song that truly showcases the singer’s talents”.  The song originally got popular when he posted a video that was shot on his iPhone to Facebook. The video showed him playing the song acoustically and has more the 3 million views.

description: If there’s one thing a good songwriter can do – it’s recognize a great song, regardless of its genre. Luke Combs showed that he has an ear for that particular talent when he chose to cover a song live in concert by pop sensation Ed Sheeran, giving the tune a distinctly country flavor while keeping its bones intact.

description: “When It Rains It Pours” is a song written and recorded by American country music singer Luke Combs. It is his second single release overall, and it appears on his 2017 debut album This One’s for You.

song_name: She Got the Best of Me
lyrics: [Verse 1] Seventeen, you don't think that much about life You just live it Like kerosene dancing around a fire But you're in it  [Pre-Chorus] So you jump right in Ain't afraid to fall And you give it all  [Chorus] She got the best of me She broke my heart Now all that's left of me Is beating in this guitar Every night, a different town She follows me around So you get what's left of me Yeah, you get what's left of me 'Cause she got the best of me  [Verse 2] I picked myself up off the floor And found something new worth living for And a, old dusty hand-me-down six string And a couple chords [Pre-Chorus] I'm getting over her A little more with every song So sing along  [Chorus] She got the best of me She broke my heart Now all that's left of me Is beating in this guitar Every night, a different town She follows me around So you get what's left of me Yeah, you get what's left of me 'Cause she got the best of me  [Chorus] She got the best of me She broke my heart Now all that's left of me Is beating in this guitar Every night, a different town She follows me around So you get what's left of me Yeah, you get what's left of me 'Cause she got the best of me [Outro] She got the best of me She got the best of me She got the best of me
description: The story behind She Got the Best of Me in Luke Combs’s own words.  I think the original thing I had was, I had a title … “You Got the Best of Me.” I remember Rob coming in and singing this thing … We had the melody thing … That was 2014. What happened was, I was still in college when I came and wrote with them and wrote the song; I was still in school, living in North Carolina. So we ended up writing it [when] I was just in town visiting. I went back to Boone and started playing the song out at my little gigs and stuff, and eventually came back to Nashville a few months later and recorded that song. I put it out that year – it was like July of 2014 – put it out on my own. I was like, “People already know that song.” There’s 50 million people that listen to country radio every week. So in my mind, I was like, “I’ve sold 50,000 copies of this. Everyone’s already heard this.” It had just been going so well. After this album came out, we were still playing it on the road, and the reaction to it was just always so good. It just kind of made sense to give it a chance. It went No. 1 on [the SiriusXM satellite radio country station] The Highway after “Hurricane.” They just wanted to play a song, so they played the version I recorded in college.

description: Luke on the surface makes this song seem like a classic break-up song, where both parties in the former relationship are trying not to think of the other. Thinking of calling the other, being just one number away and trying to get their mind off of it with mentioned tasks like watching a familiar movie. As time goes on though, the person regrets ending it and “leaving and not coming back.”  However, when the music video was released, it tells a different story. Memories of a happy relationship intermingled with realities of pain, ends in a story that a man’s lover is killed in a car accident while on her way to him, presumably after a fight they had. She’s hit while on the phone with him saying she needs to tell him something, only to be interrupted by the accident.  The song can then be interpreted as the man constantly remembering his former lover, regretting and feeling immense guilt when during the fight he said “I’m leaving and not coming back” and wishing over and over again that he could dial her phone and tell her “everything I wanna say” and listen to her voice, just one last time.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ct9BFr9XBaI&ab_channel=LukeCombsVEVO

description: Hurricane, which peaked at number 3 on the Billboard Top 100 Country Songs list is a modern ballad about an ex-girlfriend causing harm. Combs has taken time to get over his previous lover, and he is finally ready to go back out. While he is out, the girl shows back up, and he once again falls under the grasp of her beauty.

description: “XO Tour Llif3” is a chronicle of Uzi’s relationship issues with ex-girlfriend, Brittany Byrd, and substance abuse. It’s delivered over bassy and upbeat production but addresses topics like suicide and betrayal.  Ultimately, it’s a narrative mixed with strong emotional dialogue, outlining a big fight between him and his girlfriend.  LUV premiered the track in London while opening for The Weeknd’s Starboy: Legend of the Fall 2017 world tour, following the song’s leak. The title pays homage to The Weeknd’s label XO, in light of the performance.  https://www.instagram.com/p/BRVujQLAHO5/?taken-by=liluzivert  Eternal Atake’s “P2” is continuation of XO Tour Llif3. Uzi raps about moving on from heartbreak and continuing his career, problem-free. P2 is the outro to Eternal Atake, excluding two bonus tracks.

description: In keeping with the theme of the majority of songs on the project, Uzi is presumably singing about his ex-girlfriend Brittany Byrd. Taking a melodic approach, Uzi trades his metaphor filled bars for a harmonic interpolation of Oh Wonder’s “Landslide”on the chorus. He reassures himself that despite his heartbreak, time is the ultimate healer.

description: “New Patek” is a promotional single for Lil Uzi Vert’s March 2020 album, Eternal Atake.  On the song, Uzi references the luxury watch brand Patek Phillipe while bragging about his sexual encounters and accumulated wealth. He also references pop-culture icons like Naruto, Transformers, and Rey Mysterio.  The instrumental is built around a sample of the title track from the Death Parade anime series.  The song was first previewed on Instagram in June 2018, and quickly went viral. During his performance at Lollapalooza 2018, Uzi revealed the song’s title to be “5 Min,” a reference to the song’s run-time of 5:43. However, based on lyrics from the snippet, fans labeled the song as “(New) Patek,” which ultimately became the official song title.  The single artwork is a screenshot from the snippet video in which Uzi was dancing to the song. The glowing hand and the keyhole are a continuation of the Heaven’s Gate cult references present in the album artworks.

description: One of two Metro Boomin produced songs on the Lil Uzi Vert Vs. The World mixtape, Lil Uzi addresses relationship issues and unfaithfulness on “You Was Right.”  Future’s favorite producer provides a signature club-ready beat with an introspective tinge for Uzi’s regretful, yet ratchet, lyrics.  On March 2, 2017 “You Was Right” was certified  platinum, marking Uzi’s first ever platinum single.  https://twitter.com/MetroBoomin/status/841294462202593281

description: On “Money Longer,” Lil Uzi Vert contemplates how life has changed since he became famous. The song was first released a track on Uzi’s Soundcloud—a major promo tool for this North Philly rapper.  Now that he’s signed to Atlantic Records, Uzi is turning underground buzz into real money.  Lil Uzi Vert included “Money Longer” on Lil Uzi Vert Vs. The World, a nine-song mixtape released on May 27, 2016,  “Money Longer” was produced by Philly raised Maaly Raw and Atlanta legend DJ Cannon. DJ Cannon first heard Uzi on the radio while driving through Philly.  Uzi told Vibe:  He called my phone. He followed me on Twitter. Shout out to Philly, for real.

description: “Myron” starts off Lil Uzi Vert’s LUV Vs. The World 2, the deluxe edition of his second studio album, Eternal Atake.  Originally referred to as “Like Me” by producer Supah Mario before its release, the track was first previewed on Uzi’s Instagram on September 22, 2018. On November 28, Uzi previewed an extended snippet of the song in an Instagram live video.  Finally, on March 6, 2020, Uzi confirmed the track’s title to be “Myron,” along with implying its inclusion on the deluxe edition of Eternal Atake. The next day, Uzi teased two new  snippets from “Myron,” building up the hype for the track even further.  A large portion of the second verse differs from what was heard in previews of the song. This new verse is believed to have been re-recorded and switched out the week Eternal Atake dropped.

description: “P2”—initialism for Part 2—serves as the sequel to Lil Uzi Vert’s seven-time platinum-selling February 2017 single, “XO TOUR Llif3.” Over yet another TM88-produced instrumental, Uzi interpolates, replicates the flow of, and even samples the original song. The Philadelphia rapper also continues to deal with topics such as his relationship issues with ex-girlfriend, Brittany Byrd and substance abuse.  It’s noteworthy that “P2” and “XO TOUR Llif3” both stand as the sixteenth and closing tracks on their respective projects—“Futsal Shuffle 2020” and “That Way” both being bonus tracks.  “P2” was first teased by Uzi in early February 2020, when he revealed the existence of the song and previewed part of the chorus on Twitter.

description: With the help of Benny Blanco, Justin Bieber and Ed Sheeran wrote this parting song to a past lover—it’s both bitter and caring. “Love Yourself” is not as uptempo as Bieber’s recent singles  “What Do You Mean?” and “Sorry,” but the song still has a catchy, pop core.  As with Justin’s recent singles  “What Do You Mean?” and “Sorry”, many listeners can’t help but think of Selena Gomez when they hear the track. On a recent interview on The Ellen Show though, Bieber named only three songs that are definitely inspired by his ex-girlfriend: “Mark My Words,” “What Do You Mean” and “Sorry.”. This doesn’t mean that the implied ex-lover is not Selena Gomez.  Given Ed Sheeran’s contribution, it’s likely an amalgam of Gomez and one of Ed Sheeran’s exes (Athina Andrelos? Nicole Scherzinger?), if the song is autobiographical at all.  The graffiti artwork for “Love Yourself” (Justin revealed the tracklist by posting pictures of the names of the tracks graffitied on walls all around the world) can be found in Oslo, Norway. This song premiered on Beats 1 Radio along with his Halsey collaboration “The Feeling.”  On November 14th, 2015 the official music video was released. Directed by Parris Goebel, it shows an arguing couple communicating by dancing around their house. The video stars renowned dancers, Keone and Mari Madrid.  On December 6th, 2016, it was announced that Justin Bieber’s single “Love Yourself” was nominated for two Grammy Awards: Song Of The Year and Best Pop Solo Performance  Fun Fact: On March 4th, 2016, Vanity Fair recruited renown African American actor, Morgan Freeman so he could recite the lyrics to this song in a witty and humorous way.  https://twitter.com/Beats1/status/663772277075410944

description: Capping off a year filled with public apologies, “Sorry” is an upbeat anthem about asking for forgiveness.  On its surface, the second single from Purpose seems to be an apology to a woman for making mistakes in a relationship—Bieber said the song is “a little bit” about his ex Selena Gomez. However, Bieber has also suggested that the song is intended to be a more general apology to the world for his mistakes.  On “Sorry,” Bieber collaborated with songwriters Julia Michaels and Justin Tranter (both of whom annotated the song on Genius). Michaels and Tranter also wrote six songs from Selena Gomez’s Revival album, including several songs rumored to be about Bieber.  “Sorry” was produced by Skrillex and BLOOD, and it incorporates elements of tropical house, an EDM genre that’s characterized by a bright sound and Caribbean or Latin influences. BLOOD explained the music’s meaning:  The vocal manipulations make an ambiguous sound and a moment later Justin replies, ‘Sorry.’ Justin’s vocal delivery and the triumphant key of the song gave the narrative a warm color. The beat is saying moving forward, and apologizing, can be exciting and fun.  “Sorry” premiered on UK radio station CapitalFM. It was posted on YouTube together with a dance video featuring New Zealand’s ReQuest Crew. The video, directed and choreographed by Parris Goebel, features a unique new dance style that Goebel calls “Polyswagg,” a style she says combines “sassy woman fire with aggressive inner strength.”  The song debuted at #2 on Billboard’s Hot 100 chart, blocked from the top spot by the debut of Adele’s “Hello.” However,  10 weeks after its debut, it finally reached #1, dethroning Adele’s smash hit.

description: “Yummy” is the lead single to Justin Bieber’s fifth studio album, Changes, and his first solo release since his fourth studio album, Purpose, released on November 13, 2015. Its release was accompanied by a lyric video, and an official music video that released at 12:00 PM EST on January 4th, 2020.  Yummy is a term used to describe something or someone that you find very attractive or appealing. Justin uses this term to describe his wife, Hailey Bieber, to which he is known for publicly gushing over. Whether it’s commenting on photos of her, or writing a poem for her, Justin always shows just how much he loves his wife.  The song, along with its release date, was announced on December 24, 2019, via a trailer, for his album on YouTube, which also played a snippet from the track.  Bieber continued teasing the track all day on January 2, 2020, the day before the track’s release. He tweeted a snippet from the track’s apparent music video, as well as another teaser of the track’s instrumental version.

description: “Baby” is about breaking up with someone you love and still wanting them even after you’ve broken up. It’s the lead single off of Bieber’s debut album, My World 2.0. It debuted and peaked at number five on the Billboard Hot 100.  It is also one of Justin Bieber’s most popular songs of all time, with it being certified 12 times platinum by the RIAA; it was also an international smash hit, that included a #3 peak in the UK.  “Baby” was the most watched video ever on YouTube – until “Gangnam Style” surpassed it two years later.

description: Third and final promotion single off his third album Believe which was released on iTunes on June 11th, 2012.  The collaboration with an established rapper, Big Sean, surprised many people, but it seemed to work pretty well. “As Long As You Love Me” added up to Bieber’s new sound and showed he had become more mature.  The official music video for the song was released on August 1st, 2012. It features a little acting from Justin’s side; he wants to be with this girl, but her dad is against it and does all he can to break them up.

description: https://twitter.com/kanyewest/status/709070533581774848  Justin first announced “What Do You Mean?” a month ahead of its release on Ryan Seacrest’s nationally-syndicated radio show.  When asked about the song’s meaning, Justin referred to the indecision and veiled sentiments he often heard when talking to women:  Girls are often flip-floppy. They say something, and then they mean something else. “What do you mean?“ … I don’t really know, that’s why I’m asking.  To build anticipation, Justin enlisted a series of celebrities to help count down and preview the song on Twitter. Nine days before the official release, Justin leaked the lyrics in “the coolest way ever” (according to MTV) by sending them in parts to his loyal fans (the Beliebers) via direct messages on Twitter.  https://twitter.com/justinbieber/status/634038239624478721  The unique marketing worked. “What Do You Mean?” become the fastest song to reach number one on iTunes after its release, and debuted at number one on the Billboard Hot 100, the 23rd song ever to accomplish the feat.  Surprisingly, this was Justin’s first number one hit.

description: “Peaches” is a song by Justin Bieber featuring Long Beach singer GIVĒON and R&B singer Daniel Caesar.  The song is an ode to different regions of the US, with Georgia and its famous peaches serving as the central image. Atlanta, Georgia is also the birthplace of Martin Luther King, Jr, who features prominently on Justice.     The title was first spotted in Justin Bieber’s Documentary, Justin Bieber: Next Chapter, as we see the singer deciding the supposed tracklist for his next album in the studio. Singles like “Anyone” and “Lonely” can also be seen listed on the song board.    The song was first teased by Justin Bieber during an Instagram Live back in 2020. On March 16, 2021, he tweeted and confirmed the song title, and played a second live version of the song during NPR’s Tiny Desk Concert, 2 days prior to its release.

description: Lewis writes this song to a past partner whom he misses. He feels as though he gave the relationship everything and she left him anyway. Now, he just wants someone to love because he misses the way it felt with his ex.  The music video, starring the former Doctor Who star  Peter Capaldi, depicts him as a widower. He is content, but when he meets a young mother and her family, who his wife had donated a heart to, and he gets to listen to her heartbeat again.  “Someone You Loved” was Lewis' first UK number 1 single and spent seven consecutive weeks at the top. It also hit #1 on Scotland and Ireland’s charts.

description: “Before You Go” is about the aftermath of someone close committing suicide, including feeling like you are responsible for their death. Throughout the track, Lewis repeatedly questions whether he could have done something to prevent it.  Lewis teased the track by posting a snippet on his social media accounts one day before its release.

description: “Bruises” is the second track and first single from Lewis Capaldi’s first album, Divinely Uninspired to a Hellish Extent (Expanded Edition). The lyrics deftly deal with heartache and end of a long-term relationship.  He explains: “At times your memory of an old relationship will be clouded and you’ll only seem to remember the best parts of being with someone. Completely ignoring the reasons why things came to an end makes the idea of holding on to it or wanting to go back to it seem more enticing than it actually is.”

description: “Hold Me While You Wait” is a piano ballad about a breakup. It is the second single from the album, following “Someone You Loved.” As Lewis puts it in his well-renowned Instagram stories, this song is about him wanting a cuddle with his girlfriend of six months after she unexpectedly tells him that she hates him. Lewis says,  Nothing a couple of hugs can’t fix.  In another statement, Lewis said,  “Hold Me While You Wait” is a song I wrote about the uncertainty of being in a relationship when your partner isn’t sure what they want. There’s an impending hopelessness to the whole thing, on both sides, when they’re not sure whether they want to be in that relationship or not. For me it’s one of the most desperate places you can find yourself in.  “Hold Me While You Wait” debuted at #4 in the UK singles chart while “Someone You Loved” was still at #1. He became the second artist to have two singles in the Top 5, the first artist to accomplish this being Ed Sheeran. The song debuted at #1 in the Irish and the Scottish singles charts.

description: In the song “One,“ Lewis explores the difficulties of a relationship and the idea that you can give your all, but receive nothing in return. However, it is also emphasised within this song that the heartbreak that is experienced as a result of unconditional love can also be mended by another who has experienced the same.

description: “Forever” comprises the sixth track on Lewis Capaldi’s album, Divinely Uninspired to a Hellish Extent. As another love song on this album, this slow, sentimental ballad was synthesised mainly with piano and combined with a mellow bass.  Here, Capaldi expresses that everything is temporary, like relationships or life itself. No matter how hard someone tries to achieve a potential goal of a lifetime with a person you commit to, the term forever is such an abstract term which people cannot comprehend fully. Even though forever was not an initial intention of both partners in this song, a meaningful and mutual connection is always hoped and searched for.

description: “Genie” is the third promotional single and 19th track off of YoungBoy Never Broke Again’s off of his debut studio album, Until Death Call My Name.  Over a beat produced by frequent collaborator, PlayBoy On The Beat, YoungBoy talks about not being able to escape the pain, mistakes he has made in the past, and legal issues that happened around the song’s making.

description: YoungBoy NBA’s new single, he released it on September 26th, 2019. He posted the music video on the same date.  The video is notable for being filmed entirely while the artist was under house arrest.  On “House Arrest Tingz” the rapper discusses his relentless work ethic and perseverance in the face of hate.  The track was first teased in an Instagram post from YoungBoy Never Broke Again in May of 2019, which showed him recording the song in the studio.  The song first leaked online on June 20, 2019, but it was officially released on September 26th, 2019. He posted the music video on the same date.

description: “Untouchable” is a song about how YoungBoy Never Broke Again came up from nothing into something. In this song, YoungBoy describes how he wanted to quit rapping but kept going cause he knew that eventually, his fame would come and because he didn’t want to let his mother and brother too. He also explains how he’ll take his friends from the hood to success with him.  When YoungBoy was featured on the Genius Verified series he mentioned that this was the last song he recorded going into Jail and the first song he recorded when he left jail:  What’s crazy about it is it was the last thing I recorded before going in and the first one I recorded coming out. I ain’t finish it before I went in. It was the last one that I did. I came home and I finished it. It was the last and the first.

description: “Love Is Poison” is about YoungBoy’s ex girlfriend {Latisha] who gave him the herpes virus. While he was recording this song the red bump on his lip was so big it popped while he recorded his final take, that’s why the autotune was up so high. If you listen closely at 2:03 you can hear his voice get lower because of the pain he felt from the herpes popping.

description: “Outside Today” is YoungBoy Never Broke Again’s lead single for his debut album Until Death Call My Name. In the DMacTooBangin-produced song, NBA raps about his newfound problems with fame and being in the media.  On January 8, 2018, two days after the release of the song, YoungBoy released the official music video, which includes a cameo from Birdman.

description: “Amorfoda” es una canción de desamor en la que Bad Bunny se opone a las relaciones románticas, presumiblemente por las traiciones, celos o comportamientos tóxicos de su pareja, siendo publicada esta canción en el día de San Valentín.  El videoclip de la canción está grabado todo en una toma, sin cortes.  “Foda” es una jerga del portugués que se puede traducir como “joder.” Combinando “amor” y “foda” es posible que el significado de “Amorfoda” sea “Amor Jodido”  Otra posibilidad es que “Amorfoda” venga de “Amorfo”, que significa carente de personalidad y carácter propio.

description: “Tu No Metes Cabra” de Bad Bunny nos lleva de vuelta a un clásico del reggaetón. El coro tiene líneas de la canción “Esta Noche de Travesuras” del ex cantante puertorriqueño Héctor ‘El Father’.  Una versión no oficial del tema fue filtrada el 26 de mayo del 2017 por medio de su cuenta de Spotify. En vista del éxito obtenido, el 1 de julio fue anunciado el lanzamiento oficial por medio de un tweet de Bad Bunny.  A pesar del gran repertorio de éxitos que tiene Bad Bunny en su corta carrera, “Tu No Metes Cabra” es apenas su segunda canción en solitario.

[Coro: Drake & Bad Bunny] Dile que tú eres mía, mía Tú sabe' que eres mía, mía Tú misma lo decías (Tú misma lo decías) Cuando yo te lo hacía (Cuando yo te lo hacía) Dile que tú eres mía, mía Tú sabe' que eres mía, mía Tú misma lo decías (Tú misma lo decías) Cuando yo te lo hacía (Cuando yo te lo hacía)
description: “MÍA” es una colaboración entre el puertorriqueño Bad Bunny y el canadiense Drake, donde le hablan a una mujer quien es el centro de atención. Todos la quieren tener, pero ambos le recuerdan que ella misma dijo ser de ellos y nadie más.  Bad Bunny mostró un preview de la canción por primera vez en abril del 2017, en un video de su gira por Europa. Varios meses después parte de la canción fue filtrada en las redes.  Luego en enero del 2018, Bad Bunny publicó un video con Drake anunciando su colaboración. En septiembre, los dos artistas se volvieron a juntar en Miami para la grabación del video oficial.

description: “Chambea” es un sencillo de trap lanzado en 2017 por el artista puertorriqueño “Bad Bunny” cuando aun pertenecía a la compañía “ Hear This Music”, esta producido por los Mambo Kingz, Alex Killer y Dj Luian.  En el video oficial del tema, se cuenta con la presencia del ex-luchador de la WWE, Rick Flair, ya que Bad Bunny siempre ha dejado saber ser muy fan de este deporte, además de  su completa admiración por estos personajes icónicos del mundo de la lucha libre.

description: “Soy Peor” es una canción del cantante de Trap puertorriqueño Bad Bunny lanzada el 8 de diciembre de 2016, distribuida por Hear This Music y producida por Dj Luian y por el mismo Bad Bunny.  La canción rápidamente comenzó a subir en visitas, llegando a los 10 millones en poco tiempo y unas semanas más tarde se lanzó el video oficial un dia antes de Fin de Año.  Esta canción marcó la carrera musical de Bad Bunny ya que si bien antes tenía colaboraciones con artistas ya establecidos dentro de la industria, esta la hizo solo él y logró alcanzar millones de visitas en apenas semanas.

description: “Si Veo a Tu Mamá” es el tema que abre el segundo álbum de estudio de Bad Bunny, YHLQMDLG.  Elikai junto a Subelo NEO, en una base de trap con melodía similar a la de videojuegos de la época de los 80’s, recrean la melodía de “The Girl From Ipamena”.  Benito discute cómo ha tratado de superar una ruptura amorosa, pero que a pesar de seguir intentando, siempre hay pequeñas cosas que hacen que piense en su ex-pareja, que hasta incluso pregunta por ella a su mamá si se la encuentra alguna vez.

description: This song describes a relationship where the narrator can’t figure out whether or not they are meant to be together forever or if it is just a temporary relationship.

song_name: No Such Thing as a Broken Heart
lyrics: [Intro] Hey, hey Keep your chin up Hey, hey  [Verse 1] I wonder if Jack and Diane ever made it After the drums and the guitars all faded Was the best they could do good enough? Or did the heartland just swallow 'em up? How did my mom and my dad ever do it? If there was struggles, then we never knew it I guess they had each other That was enough  [Chorus] You know you can't keep the ground from shaking No matter how hard you try You can't keep the sunsets from fading You gotta treat your life like you're jumping off a rope swing Baby 'cause the whole thing's really just a shot in the dark You gotta love like there's no such thing as a broken heart You gotta love like there's no such thing as a broken heart  [Verse 2] What am I gonna tell my kids when they see all of this bullshit that goes down on TV? When the whole world is down on its luck I gotta make sure they keep their chin up Cry when it hurts, laugh when it's funny Chase after the dream, don't chase after the money And know we got each other That's what's up [Chorus] 'Cause you can't keep the ground from shaking No matter how hard you try You can't keep the sunsets from fading You gotta treat your life like you're jumping off a rope swing Baby 'cause the whole thing's really just a shot in the dark You gotta love like there's no such thing as a broken heart You gotta love like there's no such thing as a broken heart  [Bridge] You gotta love like there's no such thing as a broken heart  [Chorus] 'Cause you can't keep the ground from shaking No matter how hard you try You can't keep the sunsets from fading You gotta treat your life like you're jumping off a rope swing Baby 'cause the whole thing's really just a shot in the dark You gotta love like there's no such thing as a broken heart You gotta love, love, love, love, love (like there's no such thing) You gotta love, love, love, love, love (as a broken heart) You gotta love like there's no such thing as a broken heart
description: “No Such Thing as a Broken Heart” is about even if something bad happens in life. You have to keep your head up and  always find positivity.  Nash Country Daily describes it as  “ about facing the world head-on and not letting life get you down”.  Old Dominion has performed the song in many different places. But a select few include The Grand Ole Opry and at the 2017 CMA’S according to Wide Open Country and Billboard  Old Dominion’s frontman Matthew Ramsey told Nash Country Daily “No matter who you are, where you live or your current status, people both old and young face more challenges than ever. It’s in the face of those challenges and standing at the edge of fear that we have to remain positive. Focus on the light that comes from positivity instead of being swallowed up. Work hard at doing what you feel is right. Don’t be scared!! Live life like there’s no such thing as a broken heart.”

description: “Break Up With Him” is a fun song about a guy who gets a little bit drunk and calls up his ex-, who he happens to still be in love with, and heavily suggests that she break up with her boyfriend, because he knows she’s not in love with him.  The song gives us a little hope that the girlfriend still has feelings for our guy also, because she doesn’t hang up on him.

description: Luke Bryan’s second single from 2013’s ‘Crash My Party’ chronicles his ideal night with a lady friend, and peaked #1 on Billboard’s US Country Songs and #16 on Billboard’s Top 100.

description: “Play It Again” is a song from Luke Bryan’s album, Crash My Party. It’s about him getting a girlfriend with the power of music.  The song was written by Dallas Davidson and Ashley Gorley, and released on March 24, 2014. On April 17, 2014, “Play It Again” became Bryan’s eighth non-consecutive chart-topper on the Hot Country Songs, the most by any act in the time since his first #1 “Rain Is a Good Thing” hit the top spot on July 24, 2010.

description: Bryan wrote on his Facebook page: “It’s a song that a buddy of mine, Rodney Clawson, [co-wrote] and the second I heard it I knew it was something I was going to cut. We feel it will be a fun summertime song.”

description: This is a sultry slow jam that uses wordplay to make the point that this man and wife need to get back to the basics of love.  “Strip It Down” is an iTunes countdown single from Bryan’s 2015 album, Kill The Lights. Released with a preorder of the album.

description: Lil Durk and Dej Loaf link up together to confirm the rumors about them being a couple. This song is the first official single off Durk’s upcoming mixtape, 300 Days 300 Nights. It deviates from Lil Durk’s typically aggressive rhymes as the drill rapper professes his devotion and infatuation for Dej Loaf with some autotuned crooning. Dej Loaf follows up Durk with some gushing lyrics of her own, including a willingness to change her last name for him.  As Durk said on his “Faneto” remix:  Hit the stage with Meek Milly at his show (in Philly) He got Nicki, I just want me Dej Loaf  https://instagram.com/p/9-BJPeSmaJ/?taken-by=real_lildurk  https://twitter.com/lildurk_/status/664305237084258304

description: “3 Headed Goat” sees Lil Durk collaborate with Lil Baby and fellow Chicago native Polo G.  The title of this song alludes to the acronym “G.O.A.T” or “Greatest Of All Time” which is used to describe how each of the artists shines in their own respective ways on this track. “3 Headed Goat” shows how each of them shouldn’t be underestimated now that they’ve made it to the top.

description: From their top-selling album Rumours, “Dreams” was Fleetwood Mac’s only No. 1 hit in the US back in 1977.  The song was written by Stevie Nicks at a turbulent time for the band.  She and Lindsey Buckingham’s relationship was coming to an end.  Christine McVie was in the process of divorcing her husband, band member John McVie and drummer Mick Fleetwood was in the process of divorce from his wife as well.  Buckingham’s “Go Your Own Way” can be considered a companion piece to “Dreams” as it details the other side of the breakup from his perspective.  Audio engineer Ken Caillat recalls the origin of the song,   Most of the material for the album was composed in the studio but Stevie used to get bored, sitting around while all the technical stuff was going on, so she asked if there was a room with a piano to noodle around on.  Well, the Record Plant told her she could use Sly Stone’s studio — a little sunken room that they’d built for him to work in — and one day while we were working on some track, she came in and said, ‘I’ve just written the most amazing song.’ ‘Really? Let’s hear it.’  So, she walked over to the Rhodes — which, like everything else, was always mic’d up and ready to go — and she played ‘Dreams’. Everyone else joined in, she did a guide vocal, and that was the keeper. It’s the only time that ever happened. She tried to redo the vocal again and again, but she could never beat the original. I actually wanted her to beat it, because it had the drums leaking into her vocal mic and, in a couple of spots where she sang softly, I had to ride it up and you could hear even more of the snare. Still, it was a one-off.

description: “The Chain” is a Fleetwood Mac anthem and one of their  best-known songs.  “The Chain” is the bond that keeps the relationship going and never-ending. It can also be seen as the chain that keeps the band together; linking the members together in ways that don’t allow them to truly part ways. Written in a time when the band members were not on talking terms due to breakups and rifts in the relationships they had, the lyrics are often said to have been attacks at each other, but the band also suggests that there is some underlying love that doesn’t let them completely part ways.    In 2017, 40 years after the song’s release, it was used in blockbusters Marvel Studio’s “Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2” and Margot Robbie’s “I, Tonya” as part of the movies' soundtracks.

description: Nicks wrote “Landslide” while in Aspen, Colorado, inspired, while looking at the mountains, by the thought that everything in her life she’d been building could come crashing down at any time. It became a tale of love and life artfully woven behind the metaphor of a snowy mountain avalanche.  It was never originally released as a single (“Over My Head”, “Rhiannon” & “Say You Love Me” were the album’s three top 20 hits), but is considered one of the most known and cherished songs of the band’s decades-long career. In 1998, a live recording of the song reached #51 in the US.

description: Written during the sessions for Rumours, the Stevie Nicks-penned “Silver Springs” was left off of the record due to time constraints. It was included as the B-side to the album’s lead single, “Go Your Own Way,” to which it’s something of a response.  Years later, the song drove a deeper wedge in an already strained relationship between Nicks and drummer Mick Fleetwood. Nicks sought to include it on a greatest hits package of her own material, but Fleetwood wanted it for a box of material celebrating the band’s first 25 years.  During the reconciliation for The Dance, the tune re-emerged, finding new life in its live version and emerging as a late-career hit for the band.  A road sign for Silver Spring, Maryland, helped inspire Nicks to write the song.

description: Fleetwood Mac’s singer Stevie Nicks' signature song, one of the many classic hits produced by the group in the mid ‘70s, constantly voted as one of the top all time 500. Based on the story of a legendary old Welsh witch, Goddess – Rhiannon.    Part of the group’s second best selling album, aptly named Fleetwood Mac.

description: “Go Your Own Way” was the first single from Fleetwood Mac’s award winning eleventh LP Rumours, from 1977.  This album was written during the fallout of many relationships within the band. This song was written by their lead male vocalist Lindsey Buckingham. At the time Lindsey was dating their other powerhouse female vocalist Stevie Nicks. They were together for eight years. Stevie Nicks has said that this song is the hardest to sing live in concert with Buckingham – but its considered a fan favourite song, so she struggles through it.  One story says that the band gave an early demo of the song to a Los Angeles DJ to test audience response. The DJ then responded, saying the song would not work on the radio because of its complicated rhythm. Only then did Lindsey Buckingham add the acoustic guitar, later saying that the acoustic guitar part  was the glue that brought the whole song into focus.  This song and album is regarded as one of their best songs/albums and one of the greatest records of all time.  This song was covered by NOFX on their 1989 classic album S&M Airlines.

description: One of the biggest hits by the band, “Gypsy” is both a nostalgic reflection on Stevie Nicks’s free-spirited life before joining Fleetwood Mac and a tribute to her late friend, Robin Snyder Anderson.  Written between 1978 and 1979, the ballad was going to be on Stevie Nicks’s solo album, Bella Donna. When Nicks’s childhood friend Anderson, who was also pregnant at the time, told her she’d been diagnosed with terminal leukemia, Nicks saw the song in a new light. She then decided to save the song for Fleetwood Mac’s next album.  In regards to the song’s ideas about going back to your roots, Stevie Nicks has stated:  “In the old days, before Fleetwood Mac, Lindsey [Buckingham] and I had no money, so we had a king-size mattress, but we just had it on the floor. I had old vintage coverlets on it, and even though we had no money it was still really pretty… Just that and a lamp on the floor, and that was it—there was a certain calmness about it. To this day, when I’m feeling cluttered, I will take my mattress off of my beautiful bed, wherever that may be, and put it outside my bedroom, with a table and a little lamp.”  Nicks has also spoken about the more somber inspiration for the song:  “The song Gypsy isn’t a real happy story. Gypsy is a lot about returning to San Francisco. And Gypsy was written when my best friend [Robin] died of Leukemia and uh …about the fact that she wasn’t going to see the rest of this: I still see your bright eyes, it was like she wasn’t …going to make it. And uh, I was like the lone gypsy ~ this was my best friend from when I was 15 and so I was a solo gypsy all of a sudden and it was very sad for me and that’s sometimes when I write my very best songs.”

description: “Die a Happy Man” is dedicated to Rhett’s wife, Lauren Gregory. It’s the second single from Rhett’s 2015 album, Tangled Up, and peaked at #1 on the U.S. Billboard Hot Country Songs list.  The song received a crossover pop remix, with a new feature from Tori Kelly, and was released on April 11, 2016.

description: “Marry Me” is the song by Thomas Rhett, which appears on his 2017 album, Life Changes. According to CountryFanCast, the song has been chosen as Rhett’s third single from the album, following the success of the first single, Craving You, and the second single, Unforgettable.  As a single, the song peaked at #1 on Billboard’s Country Airplay chart .

description: “Life Changes” is an autobiographical track about how Thomas' life has changed over the years. It was first released to E! Online on August 31st, 2017.

description: “Craving You” is a story about a guy and girl wanting to be with each other the moment they part ways.  The song is the lead single of Rhett’s third album Life Changes.

description: Confirmed by The Boot, “Unforgettable” is the official second single from Thomas Rhett’s album, Life Changes, which was released on September 8th, 2017.

description: “Sixteen” is a song from Thomas Rhett, which was officially released on iTunes on August 10th, 2017 as a promo single. “Sixteen” is the third song to come from Thomas Rhett’s album, Life Changes before the album’s release, the others being “Craving You” and “Unforgettable”.  Lyrically, the song is about looking back on your younger years and wishing you could go back to those times and those great memories.

description: “Be a Light” sends an uplifting message about showing more compassion and thoughtfulness to others. The proceeds from the song go the MusiCares COVID-19 Relief Fund, as first promoted via Rhett’s social media.

description: “Say It” is a track by Canadian rapper Tory Lanez. First released during his FARGO FRIDAYS series, it would later become the first single from his debut album I Told You. It is certified Platinum by the RIAA and peaked at #23 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, marking his most successful single before 2016’s “Luv”.  Produced by Andrew “Pop” Wansel, the track samples Brownstone’s 1994 hit “If You Love Me.”  Music critic Rick Florino said of the track:  [It] sees him confidently embrace this inimitable and infectious style. It’s airy drip transfixes just before building into an undeniable refrain. Somewhere between The Weeknd’s nocturnal decadence and Future’s space ruckus, Tory Lanez rules supreme. It’s ultimately enigmatic and engaging at every turn. However, you really just need to listen to it for yourself.

description: Sampled from Chris Brown’s 2007 hit “Take You Down”, Tory Lanez and Chris Brown collaborate once again and drop a banger to show that they want to get into action with their girl.  This is the seventh collaboration between Tory and Chris and the third in 2019 after Tory was featured in Indigo with the songs “Lurkin'” and “Tell Me How You Feel”.

description: “Luv” is about not being afraid to fall deeply in love. Produced by Cashmere Cat and Benny Blanco, the track samples the dancehall track “Everyone Falls In Love” by Tanto Metro and Devonte.  “Luv” peaked at #19 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and received a nomination for Best R&B Song at the 59th Grammy Awards. Tory announced the single the night before its release, and then premiered it on HotNewHipHop.

description: On “Proud Family,” Tory Lanez samples Solange’s vocals from the theme song of the early 2000s Disney Channel cartoon The Proud Family, performed by Destiny’s Child.  Lanez also interpolates the melody and some of the words from the first verse and chorus of the song. He mixes in his own lyrics, blaming his pride for getting in the way of his relationship with a rekindled flame.

description: Tory Lanez is known for throwing shade at fellow Canadian rapper Drake in his tracks, so him remixing “Controlla” may come as a great surprise to some.  Lanez has mentioned on numerous occasions that he is coming for the number one spot no matter who’s there. Many would argue that Drake currently holds that position. The remix may have been made with the intention to provoke fans to decide who did a better job on the beat, hence, determining who is the better artist.  Following the 10 second snippet posted on Snapchat, Tory Lanez dropped the “Controlla” remix along with the “I Got The Keys (Remix).”  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WqYGbgG9_7I

description: Tory Lanez starts off the 2015 new year with a gritty banger, “Diego”. An ode to Tony Montana, the protagonist and cocaine ring leader of the cult movie Scarface, Fargo brags about his wealth and power. The title could could also be a reference to legendary footballer, Diego Maradona, who is addicted to cocaine and used it throughout his career.

description: The song title may suggest that Tory Lanez is slinging drugs, but on “Traphouse” he starts the first verse with a string of drug metaphors and a Bobby Shmurda reference.  Bobby’s “Hot Nigga” lyric (“Get up out my traphouse”) serves as a major basis for Tory’s song.  The track’s harsh lyrics are juxtaposed with Tory’s smooth singing voice.  During an annotation session with Genius, Tory explained his approach to the the record:  I’ve always had a grittiness to my music— this is a mix of the R&B aspect of it and trappin’. I say a lot of things a dude would say on a trap record— I just felt like singing it.

description: On “Let You Down,” NF laments the struggles he had earlier in his life, and looking back at himself he felt like he “let himself down.” This track is similar to his songs “Got You On My Mind” and “Wish You Wouldn’t,” from his previous album Therapy Session.  Just like “Outro” and “Green Lights,” NF tweeted the first letter of the track—in this case, “L,” which could have been alluding either to “Let You Down” or “Lie.” Nine minutes later, he tweeted out the letter “E,” largely supporting the thought of it being “Let You Down.” The track was later officially confirmed to be “Let You Down” through a separate tweet.  “Let You Down” hit No. 12 on the Billboard Hot 100 song charts, marking his first song to even hit the Top 20. It also hit No. 12 on Spotify’s Global Top 50 airing with over 2 million plays a day, and No. 6 on Spotify’s Global Top 50.  The track is the third and final single off of NF’s third studio album, Perception. NF originally teased this track on Instagram in August, however, he had removed it shortly there afterward.

description: “The Search” is the second single and title track for NF’s fourth album and marks his first release of 2019.  On the track, NF opens up about the struggles inside his head and dealing with fame. It shares a similar message to his 2018 single “WHY,” while both music videos share similar easter eggs such as the shopping cart and balloons.  The music video reveals NF free from the cage that was a frequent motif throughout his Perception album and featured prominently on the album’s cover.

description: “When I Grow Up” is the third single off of NF’s 2019 album The Search. On the track, NF shares when growing up, he aspired to be a rapper, rather than go to college or work a nine-to-five job. He also shares his motivation from doubters growing up who motivated him as an artist.  The music video was released with the release of the track, NF plays the role of many ordinary jobs including a janitor, a trashman, and a fast food worker, then finishes the video off with him pursuing his career of being a rapper.

description: On “Lie,” NF implicates over a failed relationship with his lover. He frequently declares her as being a liar by her late night phone calls and false accusations upon his reputation, and the relationship itself. After analyzing all of her actions that led up to this state, NF reveals she actually wants the relationship to continue rather than an end.  This track is produced by fellow producer, Tommee Profitt, providing us with one of the love-related songs from the album. It is also similar to some of his other songs such as, “3 A.M.” and “I Just Wanna Know.”

description: “Paid My Dues” is a surprise single, following NF’s July 2019 album The Search.  On the track, NF talks about the critics bashing his album The Search, his burdens, and internal battles. It continues the themes of The Search, being lost and looking for hope.

description: “Leave Me Alone” is a track where NF responds to fame, which is personified and originally referenced in the 2018 singles “NO NAME” and “WHY.” He wants his fame to “leave him alone” and goes more in-depth about his mental health.  On July 24, 2019, two days before the release of his album The Search, NF teased the music video for this track.  https://twitter.com/nfrealmusic/status/1154048416525066241

description: On “WHY,” NF talks about the recent success on his hit single “Let You Down,” being an outcast, his aggression and wrestles with inner conflict. Following “NO NAME,” this is the second single NF has released in 2018.  Just like “NO NAME,” this track was teased on Twitter the day of the release with two tweets, one stating “W” and the other stating “H,” however he promptly deleted the tweets.  The music video was released along with the track and became No. 1 on Youtube’s “Trending” page. It features NF in a run-down building with spray paint over the wall, very similar to the music video of “Intro 2.” He also wears black paint on his face just like in the music video for “Outcast.”  The song was later announced as part of NF’s fourth studio album, The Search, and stands as the first single released from the project.

description: Jason Derulo teams up with Nicki Minaj and Ty Dolla $ign for “Swalla,” a Caribbean-driven track that serves as the first single for Derulo’s highly anticipated fifth studio album, 2Sides.  On the song, Derulo, Minaj, and Ty go back to their island roots and deliver a sexy pop/dancehall track.  “You know we’re from the islands,” Derulo recently told Billboard. “We really took it there and it’s definitely a must-see.”  https://twitter.com/jasonderulo/status/834755941031616516

description: Jason Derulo teams with A-list sex rapper Snoop Dogg to make “Wiggle,” a joyous pop song about Derulo’s favorite thing: big fat butts. You could say it’s horny in more than one way.  The song has reached the top 10 in a number of countries including Australia, UK and USA.  In Feb. 2016, Derulo was on Jimmy Kimmel, providing a lyrical breakdown of what the song means, kinda like what he did on the site!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15jJFlIHBEk

description: Jason Derulo released “Trumpets” to International audiences as a single off his third studio album, Tattoos (2013), which he re-titled for release in the US under the name Talk Dirty (2014). “Trumpets” was eventually re-released in the US as the fifth single from Talk Dirty and peaked at number 14 on the US Billboard Hot 100.  Derulo made his directorial debut on the “Trumpets” video, and co-wrote and the song with Jon Bellion who also handled the production. “I met Jason briefly in the studio and played him some of my own solo stuff,” Bellion told Interview Magazine:  He kept my number and called me out of the blue and asked me if I had anything. “Trumpets” was one of those songs. I knew the drums were dope and it could work for someone else, but it was just a bit poppy for me. After my experience with “Monster,” I had to tell him that I wanted 90 percent of the publishing. He was cool with it, he liked it so much…

description: “Whatcha Say” is an apology song about a man who cheated on his girl and now feels sorry after being caught.  In an interview with Digital Spy, Jason mentioned that the song was based on his brother – “Basically my brother called me one day and said, ‘I cheated on my girl, but I love her so much and I hope she’ll give me one more shot’. I found his story really compelling, so I just went into the studio and tried it out. You know, people go through that kind of thing every day, which is why the song is so relatable. She did take my brother back though and they’re actually engaged now, so it all worked out good in the end.”  “Whatcha Say” became a huge success in late 2009, reaching the top of the Billboard charts on November 14.  (Fun Fact: This song was was originally written for Sean Kingston.)  Production-wise, “Whatcha Say” heavily samples Imogen Heap’s “Hide and Seek”. Find out more about the production here.

description: “Tip Toe” features French Montana, as well as uncredited vocals from Soaky Siren. The song was released on November 10, 2017, as the third single from Derulo’s upcoming album, 2 Side (previously title 777), after “If I’m Lucky” and “Swalla” featuring Ty Dolla Sign and Nicki Minaj.  The lyric video was uploaded on Derulo’s official YouTube account on the same day. Also, the single became popular in Europe, like peaking at #5 on UK Singles Chart.

description: Released on March 9th, 2015, “Want to Want Me” is the first single from Derülo’s fourth studio album, Everything is 4.  The song peaked in the top forty in eight different countries, reaching #6 in the US — Derülo’s sixth consecutive top forty hit and sixth overall top ten.

description: “July” is the sixth track and first single on Noah Cyrus' second EP, THE END OF EVERYTHING. It was accompanied by a music video on the same day of the release. The song is about heartbreak and leaving a toxic relationship.

description: “Again” received considerable controversy, considering the involvement of rapper and alleged domestic abuser, XXXTENTACION.  Despite this, “Again” makes for a smooth and dream-like pop duet, in which X becomes the latest in the hip-hop trend of recording a song entirely sung.

description: Noah Cyrus and Labrinth’s “Make Me (Cry)” is about struggling to move past an unhealthy relationship. The song is Noah Cyrus’ debut single, after signing a $350,000 record deal in 2016.  This wasn’t Cyrus’ first time in the studio, though. She sang the theme song for Disney’s Ponyo with Frankie Jonas in 2009—she also voiced the title role in the English version of the animated film.  Noah Cyrus talked about working on her music and her budding career to Paper Magazine earlier this year:  My dad always had me sing alongside him while he played guitar. He taught me how to harmonize to an old song of his, “Missing You”. Writing is the best way to get your mind clear.  It’s also a great way to explain your past or what you hope for the future.  The song follows a slower beat with a theme revolving around toxic love and heartbreak. Her raspy vocals compliments the sound as she teams up with U.K. singer and producer Labrinth.

description: “Stay Together” is about living in the moment by following somebody carelessly wandering through the nightlife with their hookup.  It’s the first collaboration between Noah Cyrus and Grammy winning writer Emily Warren.

description: “Lonely” is the fourth track and second single on Noah Cyrus' second EP, THE END OF EVERYTHING. She wrote the song when she was really depressed one day. She’s always trying to impress people but it doesn’t work (that’s what she thinks and it’s obviously untrue). She also talks about how the fame she has has restricted herself from her family and loved ones for longer than she would like.

description: Through this song, Noah describes her childhood,  growing up in Miley Cyrus', her older sisters, shadow. She described it as “absolutely unbearable” and has been “so hard” to overcome it. On an Instagram live she looks back on her experiences growing up with Miley, and being compared to her was something that happened often, she “wasn’t enough in some way”, whether it was the way she looked or the way she is.  After she has written this song, she also stated that it was a topic she never wanted to talk about again and it was a “big part of her life”.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rH1FG89E8Oo

description: The song was released on March 20th, 2020 and she debut performed it at her first UK show during her first headlining sold-out tour “The Not So Tour, Tour” in London. She said it took them about three months to put the song together and she wrote it with one of her friends Peter Harding, who was also a co-writer of her viral hit “July”.

description: “Thinkin Bout You” is the first single on channel ORANGE. Frank originally wrote it for Bridget Kelly but after his reference track leaked he recorded a higher-quality version and put it out.  Frank tries to act tough when reflecting back on a past relationship, but ultimately reveals he still has strong feelings for his ex-lover, and wonders if they have been able to move on or feel the same way he does.  The track was performed on Saturday Night Live, and was also nominated for record of the year in the 2012 Grammys. https://vimeo.com/56322097

description: “Nights” tells the story of Ocean’s previous relationship, detailing the highs and lows they both faced while dating. It also touches upon the events Frank faced while living in Houston after relocating from New Orleans due to Hurricane Katrina. The song’s title is taken from the hook, in which Ocean raps about living a life connected by rough nights.  The song’s structure is divided into two main sides; the first part is rap-heavy, accompanied by pitched up guitar riffs to provide the melody. In the second part the music turns somber and slow, serving as a parallel to a crash after a drug high.  The change in tempo is used to signify the halfway point of the album, playing further into the idea of duality established throughout the album.
