description: “If I Can’t Have You” is the upbeat, The 1975-inspired track that marks the beginning of Shawn Mendes' fourth musical era after the May 2018 release of his third studio album, Shawn Mendes. The track marks his highest ranking career debut and first top 3 hit with an opening rank at #2 on Billboard’s Hot 100.  In an interview with SiriusXM Hits 1, Shawn summarized the track as  …an elevated version of what you know as Shawn Mendes Music.  In an interview with Beats 1, Shawn described “If I Can’t Have You” as a “confident pop record” and went on to say that  This is the one that consistently every time I play it for myself, or for friends and family, it has just given people ‘that’ smile.  Shortly after the song’s release, in an interview with Rolling Stone, Shawn revealed that he originally wrote the song with Dua Lipa in mind. In a later interview with New 102.7, he clarified that he’d never contacted Dua about the song, and that giving her the track was just an idea he had.  The song’s lyrics first appeared on Genius on April 26, 2019; the same day Shawn’s manager, Andrew Gertler, teased “some serious surprises” on his Instagram. Shawn first teased the song’s release on May 1, 2019 via his Twitter.  “If I Can’t Have You” and its accompanying music video were released at midnight on May 3, 2019. The song’s first live performance  was May 4th on Saturday Night Live, where Shawn starred as a musical guest.

description: “Mercy” is a brooding piano ballad that focuses on heartbreak. It serves as the third single from Shawn Mendes' second studio album Illuminate.  During the week leading up to the release, Shawn released a snippet of the song every day, similar to the strategy he used for Illuminate’s lead single “Treat You Better.”  The “Mercy” music video shows Shawn trying not to figuratively drown in his emotions and literally drown underwater in a sinking car.

description: “Stitches” is the sixth single of singer-songwriter Shawn Mendes’s debut album, Handwritten.  “Stitches” shares some similarities with “Love the Way You Lie”—both are about loving someone so much you can’t live without them, despite how much they hurt you.

description: “Say You Won’t Let Go” is the first single from British singer-songwriter James Arthur’s second studio album, Back from the Edge. The song has peaked at No. 1 in several countries, including the United Kingdom, Australia, Indonesia, New Zealand and Sweden.  The song’s tender lyrics talk about falling in love with someone at first sight, and wanting to grow old with them. He talks about enjoying and loving her when she is young, and still wanting to be with her when she is old and grey, just as long as she “won’t let go.”  To show how serious he is about his love for her, he even expresses the desire to be with her after they both die.  James Arthur recently explained that a lot of the song came from imagination. “I wanted to write the type of song that guys would want to play for their girlfriends.”  Arthur said of this:  [It’s] about looking at the future and spending your life with someone, even after death.

description: “Can I Be Him” describes Arthur’s feelings towards someone who he loves, but they don’t love him back, and how he wants to be the boyfriend that she’s got now.  The track is a slow-tempo track, mainly supported by an acoustic backing track.

description: Arthur’s debut single, “Impossible,” was released after the finale of the UK X Factor and debuted at number one on the UK Singles Chart. It has since gone on to sell millions of copies worldwide. Unbeknownst to most, the song is actually a cover of Shontelle’s “Impossible.”

description: “Train Wreck” is about how James Arthur was in an emotionally dark place after The X Factor 2012, and not being able to come out of that place after all his mistakes, being on drugs, saying and doing things which he regrets, this song is a reflection upon those times as his previous self is calling out for help to be rid of the darkness. This song was the catalyst which sparked the creative direction and content of the 2016 album Back From The Edge.

description: The song begins with him being in a sort of denial about missing his significant other. He describes “lying to himself” about all of the signs of this other person in day to day life.  The chorus describes looking for love but struggling because only this other person can fill that space. He then speaks about drinking, overthinking, and other things he shouldn’t be doing in order to again.. fill the void. He starts to accept the fact that he may never see this other person again and blames himself for ruining it. The song ends with him asking how to make this person love him.

description: Distance is a lifestyle many couples know all-too-well, especially when one partner is serving in the military.  James Arthur’s touching video for his new love song, “Falling Like the Stars,” shows the rollercoaster of emotions when missing someone and not knowing if they’re every going to return. “I’m gonna hold you so close/I swear to god, when I come home, I’ll never let go” the crooner sings as a woman works her day jobs and reminisces on her time with her partner in the army, who ends up surprising her in a sweet coming home scene.

description: Machine Gun Kelly released this track as a response to Eminem’s disses from his surprise 2018 album, Kamikaze. On “Not Alike,” Em raps:  He wants to keep up his tough demeanor So he does a feature, decides to team up with Nina But next time you don’t gotta use Tech N9ne If you wanna come at me with a sub, Machine Gun And I’m talkin' to you, but you already know who the fuck you are, Kelly I don’t use sublims and sure as fuck don’t sneak-diss But keep commenting on my daughter Hailie[…]  Eminem also name-dropped Kelly on the first track of Kamikaze, “The Ringer,” rhyming MGK’s name with Iggy Azalea’s, another artist he has beef with. The name-drop is included in a line mocking the flow of Lil Pump’s hit song “Gucci Gang”:  So finger-bang, chicken wang, MGK, Iggy ‘zae Lil Pump, Lil Xan imitate Lil Wayne I should aim at everybody in the game, pick a name  The title “RAP DEVIL” is a play on “Rap God,” Em’s 2013 single that was a major success and considered by many to be a lyrical masterpiece.  Eminem released his response, “KILLSHOT,” on September 14, 2018, eleven days after this song’s release.

description: After months of teasing about working on his third album, and months after releasing the first single to his third album, MGK is back with a new song.  It’s about going through life with problems and making mistakes, not being perfect, but to continue holding your head high and staying positive and not giving up.  MGK announced this song on social media on March 14th, with the release date of March 17th.  https://twitter.com/machinegunkelly/status/841694798490816514  The official music video was released on April 21st, 2017.

description: “DAYWALKER!” marks the first collaboration between singer/rapper Machine Gun Kelly, and content-creator-turned-rapper CORPSE. The track is CORPSE’s first major collab since the release of his breakthrough singles “E-GIRLS ARE RUINING MY LIFE!” and “agoraphobic”.  In supernatural fantasy, a ‘daywalker’ is a vampire that can walk in sunlight unaffected. They can sustain extended periods in sunlight and even has traces of a soul. Usually, vampires burn under sunlight and are known primarily as ‘nightcrawlers’. A more well-known version of the daywalker is the Marvel Comics character Blade.  Since December 2020, both CORPSE and MGK had been teasing an upcoming collaboration during live streams and via brief snippets on Twitter, but the song’s full reveal came on March 9th, when both artists posted the song’s cover art to social media.  The song serves as a return to form for Machine Gun Kelly, after the success of his #1 pop-punk album Tickets To My Downfall, while still allowing him to branch into new directions as he fuses his own rock sound with CORPSE’s signature style of horror-core rap.  A music video for the track dropped on March 18th. Since CORPSE has not done an official face-reveal, his lines were performed and lip-synched by fellow YouTuber/streamer VALKYRAE.

description: “Bloody Valentine” sees MGK hoping for something real with a lover, taking a noticeable departure from the wary attitude he possessed about betrayal on 2019’s Hotel Diablo. He announced the song via Twitter on April 27th, 2020, calling it the “first single” from Tickets To My Downfall.  The music video for the single was released on May 20th starring American actress Megan Fox and amassed over twenty million views within its first month. Machine Gun Kelly would also go on to appear to confirm a relationship with Fox roughly a month after the video’s release.  The song debuted atop the Billboard Rock Digital Songs chart as well as charting at #7 on the Billboard Bubbling Under Hot 100 chart, #79 on the UK Singles chart, and #81 on the Canadian Hot 100, as of June 18th, 2020.

description: Alpha and Omega (ΑΩ) are the beginning and end of the Greek alphabet, and has been mentioned by the likes of Do or Die, Mr. Nogatco, and even Jesus Christ himself.  Machine Gun Kelly claims that he also is the beginning and end. The track includes references to the Egyptian god Anubis, Super Mario’s arch nemesis Bowser, God, and Martin Luther King, Jr.

description: “No Idea” serves as the first official single from Don Toliver’s second official project HEAVEN OR HELL. On the track, Don reflects on a relationship with a girl who he truly likes and shows his intent to progress further.  This track was heavily teased on Toliver’s Twitter account and most notably on Ninja’s stream with Travis Scott. It was officially announced on May 29th, 2019.  The song had an uplift because of the lip-sync/dance videos on the viral app TikTok: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_x9ywuI72Uw

description: “HAD ENOUGH” features Don Toliver and Migos members Quavo and Offset discussing their relationship with a girl who is done with them due to their past transgressions.  The track was leaked online in April 2019 before seeing its official release in December of that year as part of the JACKBOYS compilation.  “HAD ENOUGH” is also featured as the ninth track on Don Toliver’s debut studio album HEAVEN OR HELL.

description: In Travis Scott’s August 2019 documentary Look Mom I Can Fly–which focused mainly on his life–the Cactus Jack Records leader surprisingly previewed new music, a snippet of “After Party.”  In September 2019, Cactus Jack affiliate Chedda Da Connect revealed the song’s title in an Instagram comment, where he rejected the fan-made name of “Lamborghini.” On September 2, Don Toliver teased his involvement of the track via Twitter, where he reposted two lines of Travis' verse.  On November 9, 2019, during Travis Scott’s second annual ASTROWORLD festival, Don Toliver previewed a large portion of the track. In this set, the song cut off before Travis' part was played, which lead people to believe Travis Scott was cut from the song; this ended up being true.

description: On “Cardigan,” Houston artist Don Toliver reflects on his loving relationship with his significant other.  The track was previewed on August 28, 2019, during Travis Scott’s Netflix documentary Look Mom I Can Fly, where Travis offered insight into how he discovered Toliver and their music-making process. The snippet was played at the 57-minute mark, where Travis boasts about how good it sounds.  Later that day, Toliver quoted some lyrics from the song on Twitter, further teasing its impending release.

description: “Euphoria“ reunites Don Toliver with mentor Travis Scott for their fourth official collaboration. The track was first teased on Kylie Jenner’s Instagram account on January 17, 2020, where she included a snippet in her Stormi Collection cosmetic advertisement. Later that day, featured artist Kaash Paige confirmed her involvement via Twitter, where she also revealed Travis' feature and the track’s placement on Heaven Or Hell.  The track was first confirmed to be on the album via a press release, put out by Toliver’s record label Atlantic Records, on March 2, 2020. In the release, the label said:  The piano of “Euphoria“ underscores gorgeous vocal interplay with Kaash Paige as it bleeds into the blissful chant, “Drowning in euphoria.“

description: “Can’t Feel My Legs” is the third single from Don Toliver’s debut studio record Heaven or Hell. The song features Toliver speaking on nervousness when speaking to a significant other and the physiological effects the emotion is having on him, making his legs go completely numb.

description: “Murder on My Mind” is YNW Melly’s breakout song. It depicts a dark, upsetting story of Melly shooting a close friend and holding him in his arms as he slowly lost consciousness and died. Melly also mentions his previous jail time served for gun charges and drug possession. The shooting he refers to in this song happened in 2016 or earlier.  “Murder on My Mind” was soon followed up by a sequel, “Mind on My Murder,” which depicts the same events of this song from the victim’s perspective. It is subsequent in the album’s tracklisting.

description: “Dangerously In Love” or “772 Love Pt. 2” is a YNW Melly track featuring Melly’s reflections on a relationship. It serves as a follow-up to his 2017 track, “772 Love”.  The first half of the song deals with Melly contemplating about the state of their relationship as he stays locked in jail, whereas the second half deals with the aftermath of being released.  This track leaked on April 9th, 2019, later released on July 25th.

description: On “Suicidal,“ YNW Melly explains the depths of anguish and hatred he feels after a contemptuous breakup with his significant other, and compares it to taking drugs, paraphernalia, and ingesting the French cognac Hennessy to forget about their relationship together.  The track is a standout on his recent album Melly vs. Melvin, which released in November 2019.  A remix of the track featuring late Chicago rapper Juice WRLD was released on March 13, 2020, with Juice WRLD adding his two cents on the breakup and his own struggles with Hennessy.

description: On the remix of his November 2019 standout track, “Suicidal”, YNW Melly enlists the late Juice WRLD for a song about failed relationships.  The track was first previewed on Melly’s Instagram on December 8, 2019, the same morning Juice’s tragic death due to drug overdose occurred. The track was officially announced on March 11, 2020, two days before its release.  This marks the second collaboration between the two, as they both featured on Trippie Redd’s November 2019 track, “6 Kiss”. The track also marks Juice’s third posthumous feature, following Eminem’s 2020 “Godzilla“ and G Herbo’s 2020 “PTSD“.

description: In the song “Virtual (Blue Balenciagas)’‘ Melly raps about a detailed scene of murder, his selection of firearms, and his unique style of wearing Blue Balenciagas leading onto having a rival gang members blood on his shoes.  Balenciaga is a high-end, luxury designer brand originating from Spain, Melly wears Blue Balenciagas with blood on them to contrast the colours mocking the Crip gang members as it portrays one of their members blood is stained on them.    EY3ZLOW provided this beat for Melly and it was released in 2018 becoming one of his most successful tracks then being placed on the debut mixtape “I Am You” which was released on August 3rd 2018.  The “Virtual (Blue Balenciagas)” music video filmed by DrewFilmedit shows YNW Melly dancing with guns and performing a robberies with his gang. In the music video they are wearing masks similar to the nun masks from a 2010 heist movie called “The Town”. The idea of the music video was inspired from “The Town” as there are very similar themes of crime between the movie and the music video    https://youtu.be/UPS_-SJOdbM

description: “Mixed Personalities” is YNW Melly’s first collaboration with Kanye West. The song is about Melly and Kanye’s psychological battles, something that both rappers commonly focus on in their music.  Throughout Melly’s discography, he switches between himself and his alter-ego, Melvin, who has more evil tendencies. He described this in the Genius Verified video for “Murder On My Mind”:  Like, Melvin, the other, my other person inside. Melvin, that motherfucker there every day, all day. Like, that’s what he be thinking about. That nigga wake up with the murder on his mind.  Ye has even been struggling with mental health and has proclaimed that he suffers from bipolar disorder, a statement that he later retracted. Furthermore, the Chicago rapper has had an opioid addiction, which can cause a great, negative impact on the brain. He displayed his illnesses on his 2018 solo studio album, ye.  The track was previewed on Instagram on January 17, 2019, where Melly called while being incarcerated in Lee County Jail after being arrested for possession of marijuana. The Cole Bennett directed music video was released on January 18, 2019, and was also teased the day prior to its release by Bennett and Melly’s management.

description: “Mind On My Murder” is the sequel to Melly’s breakout single “Murder On My Mind” which tells a story of an altercation Melly was involved in at the age of 16 and consequently served time in jail for. In this sequel, Melly gives the backstory to the second verse on “Murder On My Mind” from the victim’s point of view.  It uses the same instrumental as “Murder on My Mind,” just slowed down.

description: On the remix to Megan Thee Stallion’s hot single “Savage,” Meg teams up with fellow Houston native Beyoncé for the first time. The two first met at a New Year’s Eve party in December 2019:    On the track, Megan spits an entirely new verse, while Beyoncé name-drops various staples of the 2020 zeitgeist, referencing everything from the phrase “Demon Time” to TikTok and OnlyFans. It features two of them trading bars with additional backing vocals by Beyoncé.

description: Released on Megan Thee Stallion’s debut mixtape Fever, the hit “Cash Shit” is the first of the numerous collaborations between Megan and Charlotte, North Carolina rapper Dababy.  Over a very simple beat provided by LilJuMadeDaBeat, the two artists elaborate on—as suggested by the title—their money: where they got it from and how they spend it.

description: Megan Thee Stallion decisively manifests herself as a “savage” on the second track from her third EP Suga, released on March 6, 2020. With plenty of references to her older songs and uplifting lyricism, it’s clear that Megan will indeed “forever be that bitch.”  Four days after Suga was released, choreographer Keara Wilson created an original dance to the track on TikTok, a popular video-sharing social media network. In the following days, the dance quickly became viral, even to the point of Megan shouting-out various TikTok creators putting their own spin to the dance.  The “Savage Remix” featuring Beyoncé was released on April 29, 2020 and an animated music video for the original version followed on May 21, 2020.

description: On “Body,” Megan Thee Stallion brags about her desirability, being the envy of other women, and the fantasy of their men.  It served as the fourth single to Good News, and dropped the night of the album’s release with a video. The track features a rapid-paced instrumental built around a sample of a woman moaning.  The music video that dropped with it featured cameos including Blac Chyna,  Taraji P. Henson, Jordyn Woods, Asian Da Brat, among others.

description: “Hot Girl Summer” is the highly-anticipated seasonal smash-hit by Houston rapper Megan Thee Stallion, who enlisted Ty Dolla $ign for the chorus, and the self-professed rap Queen, Nicki Minaj for a featured verse.  Megan first mentioned the song on July 18, 2019, via Twitter:  I feel like it’s only right I drop a hot girl summer song before the summer is over  Two days later, the rapper took to Instagram to tease a short snippet of one of her verses. Eight days after that, a longer snippet and official announcement followed, with Megan stating the track would be dropping on August 2, 2019.  On July 28, 2019, Megan had her first formal conversation with Nicki Minaj, via Instagram Live. Megan teased Nicki about her busy schedule stopping her from getting involved with the song, and hinted that if Nicki could free up her time, there would be a free space on the track.  Following this, on August 1, 2019, Megan took to Twitter to explain that the song’s release date would be delayed by seven days, but would also be “so worth the wait.” This lead to speculation that Nicki Minaj would appear on the track and needed extra time to add her verse.  On August 5, 2019, this theory was confirmed by Megan herself on Instagram:  THE HOT GIRLS TOOK OVER THE MF SUMMER SO IT WAS ONLY RIGHT TO GIVE THE HOTTIES THE OFFICIAL TRACK !!! HOT GIRL SUMMER FT. @nickiminaj and @tydollasign dropping 8/9 🔥🔥🔥🔥  Moments later, Nicki also promoted the song on Instagram. Both women shared the album artwork in their posts. An excerpt from Nicki’s caption reads:  Did I really do a verse for this song the night we got off that live?  The track’s music video released on September 3rd, 2019.

description: “Girls in the Hood” is the second single off of Megan’s debut album, Good News and was announced on social media two days before its release.  The song takes the shape of a steady trap beat that features her quintessential lyrics about haters, her lavish lifestyle and her approach to men. Similarly to “B.I.T.C.H” which came before it, Megan samples a hip-hop classic released by a male (in this case Eazy-E) and flips it to the girl version.  Upon the track’s existence being revealed to the public, Eazy-E’s daughters clashed over the sample. ReeMarkable voiced her frustration at not getting clearance to use her father’s music herself when other artists can, whilst Ebie Wright praised Megan for paying homage to her dad. Thee Stallion did not address any of this drama.

description: “Captain Hook” is the third track off of Megan Thee Stallion’s third EP Suga. The song features Megan rapping against those who attempt to get in the way of her craft and also features lyrics surrounding sex. It was released as the second single from the project and was the second song to be given a music video.

description: “Dirt on My Boots” is a song recorded by American country music artist Jon Pardi. It was released to radio on September 19, 2016 as the second single to his second studio album California Sunrise. The song was written by Rhett Akins, Jesse Frasure and Ashley Gorley.[1][2]

description: “Head Over Boots” is a song co-written and recorded by American country music artist Jon Pardi. It was released to radio on September 14, 2015 as the lead single to his second studio album, California Sunrise. The song was written by Pardi and Luke Laird. Its Pardi’s first number one hit in his career, topping the Billboard Country Airplay chart. It also peaked at numbers 4 and 51 on both the Hot Country Songs and Hot 100 charts respectively. “Head Over Boots” was certified Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA), and has sold 701,000 copies in that country as of January 2017. The song also charted in Canada, reaching number 2 on the Canada Country chart and number 64 on the Canadian Hot 100 chart. An accompanying music video for the song, directed by Jim Wright, features a band led by Pardi performing for a couple as the former goes through outfit changes and the latter ages as time passes.

description: Heartache on the Dance Floor is a song recorded by American country music artist Jon Pardi. It was released to radio on May 1, 2017, as the third single from his second studio album, California Sunrise.The song was written by Pardi, Bart Butler and Brice Long

description: She Ain’t in It is a song written by Clint Daniels and Wynn Varble, and recorded by American country music singer Jon Pardi. It is the fourth single from his second studio album California Sunrise. The song, telling of a brokenhearted man, was accompanied by a music video directed by Jim Wright. It is Pardi’s eighth charted single, reaching positions of 23 and 21 on the Hot Country Songs and Country Airplay charts respectively

description: “Vice,” the lead single off of Miranda Lambert’s sixth studio album The Weight of These Wings, is the first music we’ve heard since her much-publicized July 2015 divorce from Blake Shelton. The 32-year-old is undoubtedly in a much darker place than she was in the angry, spitfire days of “Kerosene” and “Crazy Ex-Girlfriend.”

description: A “grass is always greener” perspective on one of the main characters from L. Frank Baum’s The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, who wanted nothing more than a heart to feel emotions.  The singer, the recent victim of a broken heart, warns him how painful emotions can be and offers to trade places with the Tin Man, giving him her damaged heart in exchange for the protection of his metallic body.

description: “Little Red Wagon” was released as the third single from Miranda Lambert’s fifth studio album, Platinum.  It was originally performed by Audra Mae on her 2012 album, Audra Mae & The Almighty Sound.  The songs lyrics riff on the Willie Nelson classic, “Won’t You Ride In My Little Red Wagon.”  How did Lambert first hear the song? She explains at Great American Country:  John Eddie is an artist who has come out on the road with us before and opened a few times. He called my tour manager three or four years ago and said, ‘Hey, tell Miranda about this girl Audra Mae, specifically her song ‘Little Red Wagon.’ I think she could rock it.    Lambert performed the song at the 2015 Grammy Awards. She’s also recorded an official music video.

Lambert bought Underwood a most fitting gift as a thanks for collaborating, a brand new motorcycle!  The song made its debut live performance at the 2014 Billboard Music Awards.

description: Kentucky songwriter Chris Stapleton’s breakout solo hit is a bluesy ballad about the intoxicating power of love. The song reached #1 on Billboard’s Country Songs chart after Stapleton performed it as a duet with Justin Timberlake at the 2015 CMA Awards.  Ironically (given Stapleton’s notoriety as a songwriter), ”Tennessee Whiskey” is a cover of a country classic—it was a minor hit for David Allan Coe in 1981, and a major hit for George Jones in 1983.  Many have also noted the updated arrangement’s resemblance to Etta James' 1968 R&B classic “I’d Rather Go Blind” (a song Beyoncé covered in the 2008 movie Cadillac Records).  Stapleton recalled the cover’s genesis in an interview with Fader:   It’s always been a favorite song of mine. We had a show in Charlottesville, and we were sound checking, waiting around for the mics to get set up. Me and the guys in the band started playing a little bit and got into that groove, so I started thinking, “Man, what song could I sing over top of this?“ For whatever reason, I started singing “Tennessee Whiskey.”  At the time, we had a steel player by the name of Steve Hinson who used to play with George Jones on the road—maybe that was part of the equation. But we decided to do the song that night and every night since. By the time we got into the studio, it was something we all enjoyed playing. It’s a part of the fabric of things that influenced me over the years.

description: Either Way is the fifth song on Chris Stapleton’s From A Room: Volume 1 and Stapleton’s own version of the stark ballad he wrote a decade ago. Lee Ann Womack released a version in 2008 that had Stapleton performing back-up vocals. The song is about the indifference of a man in his relationship. Whether it continues or ends, he’s fallen out of love.  The song won a Grammy Award for Best Country Solo Performance at the 2018 Grammys held on Jan. 28, 2018.

description: “Fire Away” is the second track from Stapleton’s 2015 debut album Traveller. The song was cowritten by Danny Green and Stapleton and produced by Dave Cobb.  The song is about bracing for a heated fight with a particularly sharp-tongued lover and hanging in there no matter what as a form of “loving someone unconditionally,” as Stapleton said in an interview.  See annotations on Verse 2 for a connection of this song to broader relationship themes related to both verbal attacks and partners' natural defense responses.

description: Broken Halos is the first single that has been released from Stapleton’s From A Room and also the first song on the album.  Chris wrote it with Michael (Mike) Henderson and told Rolling Stone Magazine in an interview why it was important for him to include it on the album:  I wrote that song with my dear friend Mike Henderson, with whom I probably wrote more songs than anyone who is a co-writer of mine. I didn’t include any songs I’d written with him on Traveller, so it was really important to me … to cut songs from some of the guys who helped me learn how to write songs, and Mike is one of those guys.  Broken Halos is a song about people close to us who pass away. At his concert at the Ryman Auditorium in February 2017, Stapleton introduced the song by noting that he wrote it on the day a childhood friend passed away from pancreatic cancer at the age of 37.  The song won a Grammy for Best Country Song at the 2018 Grammys held on Jan. 28, 2018.

description: This song is about meeting up at night with a former lover with whom he has a messy background (possibly ex-girlfriend) and how he feels like she should leave before they hook up and reignite old feelings. This culminates in the third verse when it’s revealed they did hook up and she spends the night. He hopes that she doesn’t wake up and then leave his life again.

description: “Parachute” is the fourth track from Stapleton ’s 2015 debut album Traveller.  The song is the ruminations of an estranged lover who realizes that the relationship he lost—and now misses—ended because of things he neglected to say or do. He’s willing to come back if she ever reaches a time of need, even if she ignores him until then.  Stapleton performed the song on the January 16, 2016, episode of Saturday Night Live.

description: The song is most recognizable from the Apple commercial in late October 2018 for the MacBook Air.  https://youtu.be/G7iI7YmIr30  In an interview with Pop Dust on July 23rd, 2018, Chelsea Lee answered two questions about to “Trampoline.” She said that the band was simply trying to write a great song, and “Trampoline” was a build-up from working in a studio every day.  The idea behind the song was inspired by watching a home video of Max and Spencer Ernst (both are band members) jumping on a trampoline. They wanted to tell a story that played along with their surrounding environment outside of their home. This story was focused around the idea of the “Upside Down” (a Stranger Things reference), and they wanted the plot to be similar to Alice In Wonderland.

description: “Too Good at Goodbyes” tells of a turbulent personal relationship, and is Sam Smith’s first solo release since their 2015 James Bond theme “Writing’s on the Wall.” The song is the lead single from their sophomore album, The Thrill of It All.  In a Beats 1 interview, Sam explained that only four songs on the album are about them, and “Too Good at Goodbyes” is one of them. They told Zane Lowe how the song was inspired by a real relationship:  [The song is] about a relationship I was in and it’s basically about getting good at getting dumped. […] I’m still very, very single. I think I’m even more single than I was when I released In the Lonely Hour.  They also said,  At the time I was trying to convince myself I was tough, to protect myself. I was gearing up for what I knew would happen. I’m really not like that at all.  In an interview with Nick Grimshaw on BBC Radio 1 on the morning the song dropped, Nick introduced Sam by saying that “the vibes around Sam have definitely changed,” and Sam agreed. They explained that the album, due in November, is a tribute to the family and friends who supported them over the years, focusing on ‘their lives — their ups and downs’, rather than Sam’s own.

description: “Stay with Me” sees Smith yearning for a lasting relationship after a one-night stand leaves them craving more. One of their biggest hits, it’s gone #1 in countries like the United States, Canada, and Ireland, and even won two Grammy awards.  Written with Jimmy Napes and Tourist in Old Street, London studio, Smith claimed “the song just flowed out of us so naturally.” When Tourist played the first three chords, Napes quickly added a drum layer, and the rest of the track took only 30-40 minutes to write.  Upon the track’s release, listeners noticed similarities between “Stay With Me” and Tom Petty’s 1989 hit “I Won’t Back Down.” Smith’s team said that this was purely coincidental, but agreed to give Petty co-writer credits, and Petty stated that he has no ill feelings for Smith.  The music video was directed by Jamie Thraves, who also directed the music videos for Smith’s “Money On My Mind,” Radiohead’s “Just,” Coldplay’s “The Scientist,” by and Death Cab for Cutie’s “I Will Follow You into the Dark.” It features Sam walking down the street in Hackney, London, among other settings.

description: “I’m Not the Only One” is Smith’s slow realisation that their lover has been cheating on them and lying about it when Smith voices their suspicions. Smith loved him so much and they put so much of themself into the relationship that their heart won’t let them stop loving him even when they want to.  It was released in the United Kingdom as a digital download on 31 August 2014 as the fifth single from his debut studio album, In the Lonely Hour (2014). The song was written by Smith and Jimmy Napes.  An official remix of the track, featuring two verses from American rapper A$AP Rocky, premiered on 9 September 2014.

description: “Pray” is the second single from Sam Smith’s sophomore album The Thrill of it All. The song follows lead single “Too Good at Goodbyes”, which dropped just four weeks earlier.  The song combines strong gospel influnces with a hip hop beat, courtesy of Timbaland, who co-produced the song with Jimmy Napes.  Smith told Billboard that “Pray” was inspired by a visit to Iraq:  I spent five days in Mosul and came back ­embarrassed that I had known so little about the world and other people’s lives…I wanted to write about what is going on in the rest of the world, and that it’s not always pretty.  The tone of the lyric is searingly self-critical; a ‘coming-of-age’ song involving feelings of shame, guilt, newly raised awareness, and ultimately some degree of trust in whatever Power they feel might exist.  It is also a markedly intelligent song, indicating Sam’s grasp of the shortcomings and immaturity of many young people, and the shocks and processes that lead to self-growth and a compassionate outlook.  Sam Smith performed the song at the 2018 Grammy Awards.

description: http://instagram.com/p/yg29Dpx2e4/ The first single from Sam’s debut album, In The Lonely Hour.  Much of In the Lonely Hour deals with a case of unrequited love Smith suffered when they fell for a straight man and thus not interested in their advances. The singer explained during their performance at the O2 Academy in Brixton, London that they wrote “Lay Me Down” after deleting the unresponsive man from thier social media account.  Smith explained to MTV News how this was the song that kick-started their music career:  “Disclosure heard ‘Lay Me Down,’ and (after that) it was like a domino effect,” he said. “We wrote ‘Latch’ together, and then Naughty Boy heard ‘Latch’ and we wrote ‘La La La’ together, and then I had a number-one single in the UK.”  The song was re-recorded for a 2015 re-release following Smith’s commercial success. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HaMq2nn5ac0

description: After weeks of teasing on Sam’s social media sites, this song was released on July 19th 2019. Sam said that they wanted to move on from heartbreak ballads, commenting in a press release:  This year, both personally and musically, I feel so free. More than ever I have had so much fun making this record and this video…  The song is characterised by a hypnotic beat and danceable rhythm. The melody has features of Sam’s style, notably showcasing their vocal range and the distinctive timbre of their voice. The lyric, however, is of heartache and resentment – a story typical of Sam.  The accompanying music video also marks a departure, in that it features Sam’s considerable dancing skills; an unexpected surprise.

description: Sam Smith  confirmed on 8 September 2015 that he  recorded the James Bond theme song. He said on his social media:  This is one of the highlights of my career. I am honoured to finally announce that I will be singing the next Bond theme song. I am so excited to be a part of this iconic British legacy and join an incredible line up of some of my biggest musical inspirations.  I hope you all enjoy the song as much as I enjoyed making it.  Sam dropped the first major hint that he would be recording the theme song when he shared a snap of him wearing a ring emblazoned with the Spectre logo on 7 September 2015.  https://instagram.com/p/7VWisvR2Vl/  In an interview on the BBC Radio 1 Breakfast Show with Nick Grimshaw, he told that he co-wrote the song with long-time collaborator Jimmy Napes in twenty minutes. “It’s the quickest song I’ve ever written. The actual vocal on the song is my demo.” He recorded the song in January 2015.  I wanted to make the most classic, most timeless Bond song and also tried to make it an epic love song. That’s all I’m saying.  Commenting on the announcement, Bond producers Michael G. Wilson and Barbara Broccoli said:  Sam and Jimmy have written the most inspirational song for Spectre and with Sam’s extraordinary vocal performance, “Writing’s On The Wall” will surely be considered one of the greatest Bond songs of all time.  Sam Smith is the first British male solo artist to sing the Bond theme since 1965, when Tom Jones performed the task for Thunderball (Paul McCartney and Simon Le Bon also sang vocals for Bond themes, but these were credited as band performances).  The single was an international hit, and became the first Bond theme to hit #1 in the UK.  It won the Oscar for Best Original Song at the 88th Academy Awards in 2016.

description: Written by Rodney Clawson, Luke Laird, and Shane McAnally, this song was released to radio on June 20, 2014, the lead single from Chesney’s album The Big Revival.  It’s another nostalgia trip, about all the different ways one feels when looking back on those wild childhood and teen years. Think dreams. And longings. And MTV. That kind of thing.

description: Co-written by Chesney, Shane McAnally, and Josh Osborne, “Wild Child” was released in February, 2015, as the third single off Chesney’s 2014 album The Big Revival.  The song features Grace Potter’s vocals – the two previously collaborated on “You and Tequila” and “El Cerrito Place”.  Speaking about the song, Chesney told Billboard   Over the last several years, it seems like anytime anybody sings about a woman, she’s in cutoff jeans, drinking and on a tailgate — they objectify the hell out of them! […] But I’m at a point where I want to say something different about women.

description: In “All the Pretty Girls,” Chesney sings about young love and the summer romance we all wish we had.  The song peaked at #7 on Billboard’s “Hot Country Songs” chart and at #63 on the “Hot 100” chart.  Chesney held a contest, open to students from Nashville’s Belmont University and Middle Tennessee State University in Murfreesboro, to direct the music video to the single. Speaking about the contest, Chesney said:  You live it, dream it, film it. Then send it to us. I’m looking for a video that captures what this song is really about, so I’m going to the source. Have some fun with it, and show us what you’ve got.  The winners, Belmont students Jessica Martinez and William Renner, received a $5,000 scholarship in addition to their winning video being uploaded to VEVO and Spotify.

description: Chesney explained the song’s meaning: “‘Come Over’” is about two people who are as broken as their relationship is, when they realize deep down that their time together has probably ran its course, but they aren’t really ready to emotionally or physically move on to something else,“ he said. "They keep going back to each other because it’s familiar. It’s about emotionally feeling wanted in a moment, but it feels impossible to let anybody else fill that void. It’s a really sexy song with lyrics that are incredibly universal.”

description: Here, Omar Apollo reflects on a relationship with a female in which love was unreciprocated. Apollo attempts to convince himself that he is “barely in love” to assist in coping with his heartbreak. The second verse essentially details his true feelings for her, revealing his admiration of her and desire to be with her.

description: “Erase” finds Omar Apollo stuck on his ex-lover. The song is about trying to get over a past relationship and the lingering post-break up feelings.  In their review of the track, Pitchfork wrote:  Despite his lingering angst, though, Apollo’s tone is more grateful than grieving. “I still think about the time/The time I spent just trying to grow with you."

description: Hijo De Su Madre is Spanish for “Son Of Your Mother.” A common Spanish insult, meaning “son of a bitch,” is “Hijo de puta.” Apollo is satirically calling the listener’s, or “your,” mother a bitch."  “Hijo De Su Madre” is chock full of small jabs and satire, beginning with the title.

description: On “Only,” the third single from The Pinkprint album, Nicki Minaj plays with her dominance over her male Young Money labelmates and asserts her sexual and rap prowess. Producers Dr. Luke and Cirkut provided the stripped-down beat, and duo R. City helped write the track.  “Only” marks the first time the Young Money figureheads all collaborated on a studio album track (not including the compilation album track “BedRock”) and also the first collaboration between Drake and Chris Brown since their altercation in 2012. Chris recorded an unofficial verse for the track during a radio freestyle a week after its official release.

description: This highly anticipated song featuring Beyoncé celebrates the achievements of both moguls.  “Feeling Myself” could be viewed as the continuation of their acclaimed summer collaboration “Flawless (Remix)”.  https://twitter.com/NICKIMINAJ/status/539809808598454272  Hit-Boy (the song’s producer, who produced Jay Z and Kanye’s “Niggas in Paris”) broke down the song’s production on this video.    The official video was released on May 18, 2015 exclusively for Tidal subscribers, however it quickly leaked to the internet. The video features choreography from Parris Goebel, the then-23 year-old New Zealander who would blow up later in 2015 when she choreographed and directed the video for Justin Bieber’s “Sorry.”

description: On “Barbie Dreams,” Nicki pays homage to The Notorious B.I.G., delivering her take on his classic 1994 track “Just Playing (Dreams).”  Unlike Biggie, who rapped about his attraction to popular female R&B singers, Nicki decides to roast prominent male artists and athletes. It’s all in good fun, though, as most of the rappers Nicki puts down are friends and collaborators. A few of them are even featured on the album Queen, including Lil Wayne and Swae Lee.  Nicki previously used the “Just Playing (Dreams)” beat on her 2007 track “Dreams” from her mixtape, Playtime Is Over.  In an August 2018 episode of her Beats 1 Queen Radio show with Zane Lowe, Nicki broke down the track, saying:  Reading the reaction to ‘Barbie Dreams’ is hilarious. Everyone is saying how disrespectful [the song] is and that’s why I fucking love it. ‘Barbie Dreams’ is gonna go down in history. Shout outs to B.I.G. you are still inspiring rappers every day. This man is still inspiring me every day. He’s one of the first rappers who had a sense of humor. I love dope writers who can write bars and make you laugh. Eminem [after that] too. I think [humor] shows a person’s IQ and [wittiness].

description: “Truffle Butter” was released as an iTunes-exclusive track off of the deluxe version of Nicki Minaj’s fourth album, The Pinkprint, and features longtime collaborators and labelmates Drake and Lil Wayne.  Although the song’s title was originally thought to be related to a popular sexual term from 2015, it mostly references “truffle butter” as a symbol for luxury, with a few lines from Drake and Wayne pointing to the former.  The trio stunts about their lavish lives over a Nineteen85 beat that samples Maya Jane Coles' 2010 song “What They Say.” The song has been compared to the previous Young Money joint single “Only,” another cut from Nicki’s album.

description: Named after the first female character in the video game series Street Fighter (or any fighting game), “Chun-Li” was released alongside “Barbie Tingz” on the 12th of April, 2018, after Nicki Minaj’s 4 month hiatus from social media. The singles were the first songs from her fourth studio album Queen.  Throughout the song, Nicki compares herself to Chun-Li, a martial artist who seeks revenge for the death of her father, by saying she’s one of the first female rappers to dominate the rap game, and still dominates it despite her rivals' efforts to put her down.  Along with these comparisons, the cover art depicts her donning the same hairstyle as the character:    Chun-Li in Street Fighter V.   She also previously referenced both Street Fighter and the character in her verse on 2011’s “Fireball” by Willow Smith, where she raps:  Ok I’m the street fighter, call me Chun-Li

description: “Beez In The Trap” is the first song shared by Nicki Minaj and 2 Chainz and is taken from Minaj’s second studio album, Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded. The song marks the beginning of many collaborations between the two, such as “I Luv Dem Strippers”, “Realize”, and “Big Bank”. The track was released on May 29, 2012, and the official music video was released almost two months prior on April 6, 2012.  On the track, Nicki and 2 Chainz rap about “beez in the trap”, or being in a place where one can obtain drugs or money.

description: Nicki goes big—literally—with a song about butts, sex, and more butts, backed by a “Baby Got Back” sample, nonetheless.  “Anaconda” is the 2nd single for and 12th track on Nicki Minaj’s third studio album, The Pinkprint, and it’s loaded to the brim with sexual innuendo.  The single’s artwork caused quite some controversy over the brazen imagery of her bare tuckus.

description: “Malibu” is about Miley getting back together with her fiancé Liam Hemsworth after their breakup in 2013. In a May 3, 2017 interview with Billboard, Miley spoke about the breakup:  I needed to change so much. And changing with someone else not changing like that is too hard. Suddenly you’re like, ‘I don’t recognize you anymore.’ We had to refall for each other.  Hemsworth has previously been the subject matter of Miley’s music; he was the inspiration behind her 2013 hit “Wrecking Ball.”

description: “Wrecking Ball” is the second single off of Miley’s fourth studio album Bangerz. The song is a pop ballad produced by Dr. Luke, who first came to fame in 2004 when he produced Kelly Clarkson’s “Since U Been Gone.” Critics have praised the song for its emotional delivery, comparing it to other famous ballads like Celine Dion’s “My Heart Will Go On” and Sinead O'Connor’s “Nothing Compares 2 U.”    The song has been interpreted as a ballad about “love lost and found, but also about—again—the idea of youth burning hard and fast and then fading away.”  The controversial video features a nude Miley swinging on an actual wrecking ball. The singer explains:  The song is a pop ballad that everyone can relate to; everyone has felt that feeling at some point. If people can take their minds off the obvious and go into their imagination and see what the video really means, it is so vulnerable.  The song hit number one on the Billboard Hot 100 in September 2013, making it Miley’s very first number one single.  It is rumored that the song was initially written for Beyoncé. In December 2012, Sacha Skarbek tweeted, “Beyonce song now becoming a Miley Cyrus song?!! Good/bad? I don’t know??!!!!”

description: “We Can’t Stop” was the first single from Miley Cyrus' 2013 album Bangerz, and as such, many people’s first taste of the bolder Miley we now know.  Like her early hit “Party In The USA”, “We Can’t Stop” is about partying and having a good time. Unlike “Party in the USA”, “We Can’t Stop” is a slower, more bittersweet track, with a little language (the only swear word here used is “hell”), a little sex, and a few drug references. (The producer denies the latter.)  Distancing yourself from Disney takes some work, but this is the moment Miley’s due diligence began in earnest. This track is rife with hip-hop references—part of Miley’s move towards an edgier, new sound.  The song peaked at #2 on the Billboard Hot 100.

description: “Slide Away” is Miley Cyrus' first song since “On A Roll,” which was released on June 5th earlier in 2019.  This song was released in Miley’s response of her and Liam’s break up. This song closes in on Miley planning to move on. Although the lyrics are devastatingly heartbreaking, “it’s time to let it go” tells us that if you love something, you’ve got to let it go, let it slide away.

description: “Midnight Sky” is a disco-pop single by Miley Cyrus. It is her first single released in 2020, and follows her 2019 hit “Slide Away.” The song talks about her free spirit while addressing some of her past relationships.  On August 4, 2020, Miley teased a snippet for the song in a post; and on August 7, she revealed the cover art and release date on her Instagram.

description: “Party in the U.S.A.” was co-written by English singer-songwriter Jessie J; she originally intended to sing it (listen to the leaked snippet of the demo version), but decided to pass the song over to Miley after concluding that it didn’t fit her persona:  That was my first week of writing after I signed to (Universal) Republic (Records), so it was like the first big kind of writing session for my debut album … and it was one of the first songs we did. And I remember thinking this song is amazing, but I don’t know if it’s me 110 percent, you know. You can kind of feel it. It was cool but it wasn’t edgy enough.

description: “Mother’s Daughter” is the only single from “SHE IS COMING,” the first of three six-song EPs, followed by “SHE IS HERE” and “SHE IS EVERYTHING.” Combined, they make up Miley’s seventh full-length studio album titled “SHE IS MILEY CYRUS.”  The song was written by Miley Cyrus, with the help of her friend, Andrew Wyatt and pop singer, ALMA.  It’s a strong and direct statement of Cyrus’s political commitment to feminism and LGBTQ+ movements, as well as her evolution and growth as an artist and a woman.  In June 2019 she uploaded a photo on Instagram of herself licking a cake that read “Abortion IS Healthcare.“ She added hashtags supporting women’s rights and wrote that this song is about the struggle against the recent wave of abortion restrictions in the USA.

description: “Believer” thunders around a percussive backbeat and expressive vocals from Dan Reynolds to bring about a message of embracing pain, and using it as a tool for personal growth. It marks the end of Imagine Dragons' self-imposed hiatus that started in 2016. The song acts as the title for their documentary surrounding LGBT youth and the Mormon church.  The song was released on the first of February as the lead single for their third studio album, Evolve, and was featured in a commercial for the Nintendo Switch that premiered on Super Bowl LI. The song was also featured in the first trailer for Kenneth Branagh’s Murder on the Orient Express remake.  Nearly two years after its release, the band released a remix of the song alongside Lil Wayne during their 2019 National College Football Championship halftime performance.

description: “Thunder” is the second single from Imagine Dragons' third album, following “Believer”.  “Thunder” is about not conforming to society’s standards. Dan sings about being told what to do as a child, and that he can’t follow his dreams. In the second verse, he says that he overcame everyone that told him what to do, and achieved his dreams of being on stage.  “Thunder” peaked at #4 on Billboard’s Hot 100, and scored the band their first song to surpass 1,000,000,000 (one billion) views on YouTube.

description: While the fast-paced verses of “Whatever it Takes” propels Imagine Dragons into new territory, the big and booming chorus retains a sense of their signature sound.  The song is about being the best at what you do no matter the obstacle, a theme found to be prevalent on the album.  The song was released as the first promotional single from EVOLVE after official singles, “Believer” and “Thunder.”

description: “Demons” is the fourth single from Imagine Dragons' debut album, Night Visions, and the lead track for the band’s Demons (Remixes) – EP. The track is about acknowledging and battling your insecurities and inner flaws, characterized as your “demons.”  “Demons” marks the band’s second track to chart for over a year, following the incredible success of “Radioactive.” This song was also used as the theme song for the 2015 Chinese film, Jiu ceng yao ta (Chronicles of the Ghostly Tribe).

description: The first song on Imagine Dragons' debut album Night Visions gives off a revolutionary vibe, but leaves what is being changed up to interpretation. Some argue it is about nuclear war, others say it is about Wall Street and similar protests, and some think it is really talking about the end of the world. Regardless, it is a powerful song bound to inspire debate on its meaning.

description: “Natural” is Imagine Dragons‘ third single after the release of Evolve, following their collaboration with Kygo on “Born to Be Yours”; it is the lead single for their fourth studio album, Origins. The single’s artwork features the same artist from Evolve, Beeple.  According to Dan Reynolds, the song is about becoming a little ruthless and calloused with time as you realize you have to fight and stand up for yourself. This song became the anthem for 2018’s ESPN College Football season and was even featured as Amazon Music’s and Shazam’s Song of the Day.

description: Touching on the topic of the tough year lead singer Dan Reynolds and his wife Aja Volkman had following their announcement of their divorce on April 26, 2018, “Bad Liar” is the fourth single from Imagine Dragons‘ fourth studio album Origins. The track was released the day the pair announced they hadn’t actually signed the divorce papers and were dating once again and were back together again, just days before the release of Origins.  “Bad Liar” is solely about Dan Reynold’s marriage, and the frontman recruited his ex to help him out with the song, as explained in an interview taking place shortly before it was released, making Aja Volkman a co-writer.

description: 24kGoldn enlists the help of friend iann dior for “Mood.” The two have collaborated in the past, most notably on iann dior’s “gone girl,” which credits 24kGoldn as a co-writer.  Throughout the track, the two reflect on being stuck in a toxic relationship with a woman who is fickle, indecisive, and often manipulative. Despite the tone of the subject matter, the track is upbeat and poppy, carrying a similar tone and structure to “Never is Enough” from iann dior’s debut album Industry Plant.  The song was first teased on an Instagram story from 24kGoldn on May 1, 2020. A few weeks later on May 22, the same date as the release of iann dior’s single “Prospect,” producer Omer Fedi posted a video of 24kGoldn and iann dior dancing to the track on his Instagram story, with the caption  U think they ready?  A snippet of “Mood” was first released on the creator community platform Zebra on June 15, 2020. 24kGoldn later posted a Tiktok four days later, encouraging his fans to join his community on the app.  On July 19 2020, 24kGoldn confirmed the track after uploading a Triller of the song with iann dior to his Instagram.

description: On “VALENTINO,” 24kGoldn boasts his high profile lifestyle, as well as sharing his personal desires.  It was first released on February 1, 2019. However, in late 2019, the song grew popular on TikTok, where it was frequently used as a “sound” for many users.

description: “CITY OF ANGELS” is the fourth track off 24kGoldn’s first official EP/Album, “DROPPED OUTTA COLLEGE.”  The track name “City Of Angels” refers to the Californian city of Los Angelos, which is nicknamed the “City of Angels,” due to Angelos translating to angels.  The song concentrates on 24kGoldn’s love for designer clothing and how he “sold his soul to the devil” just to have designer. Alongside, the track also shows 24kGoldn reflecting on a previous relationship with a female which didn’t work-out, due to him only wanting to have sex with her.  The music video was released on March 20, 2020. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yHwGIA4VeOc It was teased by 24kGoldn in an Instagram post on March 7, 2020. It showed him in a red suit, the same he wears in the music video. The location was also tagged “City Of Angels.”  The song was also highly popularized due to the many lip-sync/dance videos created on the viral social media app TikTok : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l8l5tIwQOl8

description: 24kGoldn recruits fellow XXL Freshman DaBaby for “Coco,” the second single from 24kGoldn’s debut studio album El Dorado. The song is named after Gabrielle Bonheur “Coco” Chanel, founder of the French fashion house Chanel.  The song follows 24kGoldn’s chart-topping single, “Mood” and shares a similar structure with the hit, as the upbeat instrumental plays under the lyrics of a dysfunctional relationship.  “Coco” was first previewed in late October 2020 during a GrubHub sponsored “Sound Bites” performance. 24kGoldn would later preview the song again on November 17th, 2020 during an Instagram Livestream. The song also featured a new verse that was not previously previewed.  Nearly two weeks subsequent to the tracks release, on December 17, 2020, a Cole Bennett-directed music video for the track was released.

description: “3, 2, 1” marks 24kGoldn’s first release of 2021 and serves as the third single to El Dorado. On this song, he sings about loyalty, asking his significant other to always be truthful with him and to not hide things.  The singer teased this song in an Instagram post on February 11, 2021. Four days later, he revealed the cover art. The following day, he revealed the release date with a snippet of the official music video.  On February 19, 2021, the accompanying visuals were released concurrently alongside this song. Fifteen minutes before its release, a live stream was held exclusively.

description: “GAMES ON YOUR PHONE” is about 24kGoldn wondering if his girlfriend thinks about him while playing games on her phone  The song was produced by Chicago producer “d.a. got that dope” who also produced his song “DROPPED OUTTA COLLAGE” alongside producer AObeats and guitarist Omer Fedi  The song made an appearance on his EP “DROPPED OUTTA COLLAGE” in November 2019

description: “DROPPED OUTTA COLLEGE” is the young San Francisco rapper’s response to those who criticized his decision to drop out of University of Southern California, wanting to focus on his career as a rapper. It was released as the fourth single of the album of the same name.  The song’s humorous music video, which premiered on the same day the song was released as a single, stars 24kGoldn as a young college dropout who begins to become a father figure of sorts to his friend, played by Sebastian Cabanas, whose mom, played by Elise Muller, he has hit it off with.

description: “One Day” is Tate McRae’s debut single, posted to YouTube on October 20th, 2017. In the song, Tate speaks about unrequited love and the inner thoughts of a girl and a guy pining over each other.  It was initially recorded in Tate’s bedroom unprofessionally. Since then, the video has amassed over 25 million views on YouTube and compelled Tate to professionally record it and release it on streaming platforms. This new recording was released on December 28 of the same year.  Prior to the upload of this song, Tate would upload dance videos and vlogs, after placing runner up on So You Think You Can Dance, the Next Generation.  The viewer response is what encouraged Tate to continue uploading her covers and original songs.

description: “you broke me first” finds Tate confronting an ex who’s returned and wants to rekindle their painful relationship.  The song initially released on McRae’s YouTube channel on April 12, 2020, with piano instrumentals only. On the official release five days later, drums, backing vocals, and other instruments were added to the production. Some melodies were changed between Tate’s first and official versions.  In an interview with outnowmagazine, Tate talked about the importance of the song:  ‘You broke me first’ is a really special song to me. This song is about someone in a relationship who couldn’t care less for the other person and then 6 months later decides to crawl back. It’s the feeling of knowing how much they meant to you, but this time not letting them back in. I hope everyone can connect to this song like I do.

description: ‘dear ex best friend’ is a song by Tate McRae about her and her friend losing contact and not talking to each other for a while. She expresses her regret and wonders if her ex-friend thinks of her too. She says lines like ‘we really messed up this time’ and ‘wonder if my name has ever crossed your mind’ to deliver the concept.

description: Although the song title ‘'dear parents…’‘ would indicate that this song is completely directed at parents, Tate has explained that it is actually not. In one of her videos, she explained that this song is less of a jab to her parents, and more of an insult to herself:  I feel like, teenagers, when they don’t know how to figure themselves out, they blame it on their parents. Obviously.  Nevertheless, the parents are not entirely blameless either:  It’s kinda weird because our parents went through it before. Then why do they react to our choices like they’ve never heard of them before?  Tate tried to capture the disagreements with her parents and struggles with herself on this track. In the explanatory video, she pronounced her wish to write about how difficult it can be to be a teenager sometimes:  I have the most complicated mind ever, and I honestly never know what I am feeling. And I can never, ever, put it into words.

description: “stupid” is the first track to Tate McRae’s debut EP all the things i never said and her final single before the release of the EP. In the song, backed by minimal pop beats, Tate pours out her feelings for a guy she knows is bad for her. In other words, she’s “stupid” for him.

description: Tate has explained in a video that this song is about the pressure that is on teenagers nowadays. She sings about different stereotypes in this song to bring across the message that:  You are never going to be happy enough if you are always thinking about what the other people are doing.  Tate also wanted to sing about the capriciousness of a teenager’s life. For example, things that may seem to play a big role in your life now, will probably only be a small thing when you look back at it. Furthermore, teen’s moods change all the time:  Some days, I’ll be like, ‘I’m so happy, I love my life!’ And the next day I can be an absolute disaster. And I have no idea why.  Tate wanted to bring all of these aspects of the lives of adolescents together in this song, that is fittingly called ‘'Teenage Mind.’'

description: Considered one of his most popular songs, “Magnolia” is an emblem of Playboi Carti’s fast and loose lifestyle—he rhymes about cops, sex, and drugs, all over a beat by Pi'erre Bourne. The title refers to the Magnolia Projects, which fits the bouncy New Orleans-inspired production.  In March 2017, Carti previewed the song during his SXSW performance with producer Southside. On March 19, Carti went on Twitter to drop a promotional trailer for his debut mixtape, which featured a segment of the song as a backdrop. Later that day, Carti and Southside played the full song on Instagram Live.  During a June 2017 interview with The Fader, Pi'erre Bourne discussed linking up with Carti and producing the song:  I made [Magnolia] in the car. […] People might not know the whole story going into the songs, but the beats I gave Carti I made day-of or the day before the session. All of March, we were cooking it up.  Since its release, “Magnolia” has received massive acclaim—it debuted on the Billboard Hot 100, and peaked at #29 in July 2017. Moreover, it has been certified 3x platinum by the RIAA.  The official music video dropped on July 10, 2017, featuring footage of Carti on the streets of New York, with cameo appearances from A$AP Rocky, A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie, and Don Q, among others.

description: “wokeuplikethis*” is a direct confrontation to imitators of Playboi Carti and Lil Uzi Vert’s distinct and unique style. The track features the classic hip-hop tropes of money, drugs and women. However, Carti expresses his frustration with the copycat genre throughout the chorus. One such imitator may be Smokepurpp, who copied the vocals and production of Carti’s 2014 single “Smash” in 2016. This song makes it clear that Carti and Uzi consider one and other as pioneers of the late 2010s generation of trap music.  This track marks the fourth released collaboration between Playboi Carti and Philadephia-born rapper Lil Uzi Vert. The song was released as a single along with “Lookin” (which featured Lil Uzi as well) prior to the release of Carti’s debut mixtape Playboi Carti.

description: “Shoota” was recorded on July 6, 2017. Carti previewed a video of the instrumental on Snapchat. A rough demo of the track was leaked on May 2, 2018. It featured more Auto-Tune vocal pitch correction and a second verse from Uzi.

description: “Fetti” is a track by Playboi Carti featuring South Texas rapper Maxo Kream and New Jersey emcee Da$h. The song was first released on April 26th, 2015 on Playboi Carti’s SoundCloud, and a mastered version was released on May 3, 2016, by Chris Fresh.  The track features all three rappers speaking on topics like their monetary wealth to their drug use, from substances like lean to marijuana.  The full-quality version of the song was leaked on April 10, 2020.

description: “Long Time” begins Playboi Carti’s debut album with an ode to the determination that allowed him to become successful as a recording artist and the luxuries he can enjoy since releasing his acclaimed 2017 eponymous mixtape.  The track was rumored to originally be the outro of Die Lit with “Check Please” as the intro; “Check Please” was leaked on May 2, 2018, so it was not released.  Carti previewed an alternate version of the instrumental on September 29, 2019, at his Rolling Loud Bay Area concert.  The track marks Art Dealer’s first record production for Carti.

description: “@ MEH” finds Carti disregarding his opposers and any hate surrounding him.  “@ MEH” marks Carti’s first solo release since his debut album Die Lit in May 2018.  The phrase “at (@) me” is typically used on social media sites such as Twitter as a form of mockery after a subtweet.  It’s worth noting that Carti had the phrase “@@@ me” in his Instagram bio from the start of 2019 until this single was released. In a June 2019 interview with The FADER, Carti explained that he stays away from the negativity of social media:  I just look, then I get off, ‘cause I get upset.  Carti first teased a new release on April 14, 2020, when he shared the single’s artwork on social media. Information about the track surfaced on a music blog the next day before a snippet was leaked.  The song features production from Deskhop, Neeko Baby, and jetsonmade, who have not worked with Carti before. It was accompanied by a music video directed by Carti and Nick Walker.

description: “Not Real” (referred to by fans as “Molly” before the real track name was known) is an unreleased track recorded in 2018 for Playboi Carti’s album Whole Lotta Red. The song’s vocals are an extension of the baby voice notably used on “FlatBed Freestyle” with the incorporation of a cracked cadence inspired by Future’s signature voice-cracked crooning.  The song was previewed during Carti’s Neon Tour in Seattle on November 6, 2018, and later in Miami.  The track was leaked on June 6, 2019, with an open verse.

description: “Moral of the Story” is Ashe’s farewell to a past relationship. It is the first release since her debut EP, The Rabbit Hole and the title track to her two-part EP series.  The track saw its peak in early February 2020, almost a year after its initial release, when it was featured in a pivotal scene in the teen Netflix film To All The Boys 2: P.S. I Still Love You. Genius said in its own article that the song “saw an immediate spike on Genius, skyrocketing from 268 [daily] pageviews to 13,152 overnight.”

description: Niall Horan hops on the remix to Ashe’s hit song “Moral of the Story,” taken from her two-part EP under the same name.  Ashe first teased the remix on June 12, 2020 when she posted a screenshot of her and the mystery feature on a FaceTime call to her social medias. The next day, after a plethora of fan speculation, she confirmed the feature was, in fact, Niall Horan.

description: “Save Yourself” serves as a spiteful response to her hit April 2019 single “Moral of the Story” and its success being birthed from her divorce.  This anger Ashe expresses in the song, which weaves its way throughout the lyrics, serves as a “sobering reminder” about the nightmare of the relationship with her ex-husband. By freeing all of her pent up angry feelings towards her then-partner, as well as to herself for ignoring the signs, she is saving herself now when she could not free herself from back then as quickly as she could have.

description: “Me Without You” is the seventh single off of Ashe’s highly-anticipated debut studio album, Ashlyn, released May 7, 2021. The song is about moving on after a relationship, and finding who you truly are without the need for someone else.  Sonically, “Me Without You” sees Ashe sticking with her vintage aesthetic, complete with lots of layered vocals, bass guitar, and orchestral elements throughout.  The song was released alongside an accompanying music video, which sees Ashe dancing in a bar, and being true to herself.

description: In a 2018 Vevo performance of this song, Ashe said, “‘Real Love’ was sort of my statement of acknowledging that life is both really good and super f-cked– and that no matter who you are, you’re not immune to that truth.” She expanded the statement by explaining that she wanted people to listen so she started off with a 5-minor chord, which is not your typical chord progression.

description: “Ryne’s Song” is an incredibly raw, vulnerable track that Ashe sings like an open letter towards her brother, who had passed away.  In the lyrics, she expresses sadness, gratitude, potential regret, and lost time; of realizations that weren’t picked up on until it’s too late. Interwoven throughout the track, it is extremely apparent how much her brother meant to her, and how much he helped to shape her into who she is today.

description: Five Internet Money Records producers team up and enlist Gunna, Don Toliver, and NAV for “Lemonade,” the second single off of Internet Money’s debut studio album B4THESTORM. The song was released alongside an accompanying music video directed by Cole Bennett of Lyrical Lemonade.  This single was first previewed by Internet Money founder Taz Taylor during a June 2020 Instagram live. Gunna then previewed a snippet of his verse later that month.  The song then saw several leaks before surfacing in its entirety on July 14, 2020. Notably, a demo of Don’s solo version of the song leaked on June 24, 2020, revealing a verse absent from the final song.

description: “Somebody” is the first collaboration between Lil Tecca and A Boogie Wit da Hoodie. Produced by Internet Money producers Nick Mira and Taz Taylor, the rappers explain their need for a real girl that loves them for who they are rather than for what they have.  On July 30, 2020, Taz Taylor featured on an interview hosted by Lyrical Lemonade, where in the interview, Taz revealed that the track would feature on Internet Money’s collective album, B4THESTORM.

description: Internet Money enlists the help of frequent collaborators Trippie Redd and Juice WRLD to croon about failed love and fake women on “Blastoff,” a reflective track that focuses on past relationships.  On October 13, 2018, Trippie previewed a snippet of the song on his social media account, where he played a small part of his own verse and teased Juice’s vocals. On December 7, 2019, producer Taz Taylor previewed a longer snippet with an alternative instrumental.  Juice and Trippie were close friends and previously teased a joint project during a September 2018 No Jumper interview.  Two early demos of the track leaked throughout the late months of 2019. The track was later confirmed to release via Internet Money’s collaborative album, B4 THE STORM, on August 28, 2020 as the song appeared on the album’s final tracklist.

description: On “His & Hers,” Internet Money producers reunite with Don Toliver and Gunna after collaborating on the summer 2020 hit “Lemonade”. This time around joined by Lil Uzi Vert, the artists deliver catchy melodies over an IM-produced beat.  Mainly conducted by IM founder Taz Taylor and video director Cole Bennett, the teasing of the track began on April 1, 2021, with Taz Taylor’s announcement of the collaboration. After the leak of a demo and several delays, Taz finally announced the song’s release on May 13, 2021.  Just like “Lemonade,” the release of “His & Hers” was followed by the premiere of a Lyrical Lemonade music video, giving more exposure to the song.

description: “Lost Me” is a collaborative release from artists Lil Mosey, iann dior and Lil Skies. On the track, the trio boast about their luxurious lifestyles; an influx in currency, exotic sport vehicles and excessive use in narcotics.  The original title of the track was “Kobe”, however the professional basketball player Kobe Bryant passed away due to an accidental helicopter crash on January 26, 2020. Out of respect, Taz Taylor later changed the track’s original title from “Kobe” to “Lost Me”.  Due to a problem with the artists and record labels in early 2020, the track was originally scrapped from the album as Taz Taylor explained in a tweet.  On April 21, 2020, all of the artists and labels reunited as iann dior confirmed the track was releasing soon. The track was confirmed to be featured on the collective Internet Money album, B4THESTORM.  After much long-awaited anticipation, the track was finally released on August 27, 2020, along with a lyric video.

description: Roddy Ricch joins Don Toliver on the official remix to Internet Money’s August 2020 hit single “Lemonade,” which originally featured verses from NAV and Gunna. The two rapper’s contributions are replaced by new verses from Roddy and Don—the latter was leaked three months before with Don’s demo of the song.  Founder of Internet Money, Taz Taylor announced this remix in a tweet on September 15, 2020:  If yall get lemonade top 10 billboard then ill drop this remix with roddy and don. but only once it gets top 10.  During the week of Taz Taylor’s initial announcement, September 19, 2020, “Lemonade” peaked at #27 on the Billboard Global 100 charts. Later, it then peaked at #6 on the charts during the week of October 3, 2020.

description: “Without Me” is the first new song released by Halsey since her 2017 album, hopeless fountain kingdom. The track is directed at her ex G-Eazy after she was “cheated on in front of the entire world, like, a billion times.”  This song dives into the personal feelings of Halsey after being a very public relationship. The track is different to her earlier conceptual records Badlands and hopeless fountain kingdom, due to the fact there was no role to play:  It’s the most raw thing I’ve ever made… Here, I have this record where it’s just me, no character. It’s about my life and my relationship that the world has watched so closely… It’s just me.  The song premiered on Zane Lowe’s “World Record” on Beats 1 Radio, and was followed by an interview with the artist about “Without Me”.  In that interview, Halsey stated that the song was not going to be part of a future album, and described it as a “stand-alone record;” however, on 13 September 2019, “Without Me” was revealed to be track 9 on her third studio album Manic.  In honor of the song hitting #1 on the Billboard Hot 100, Halsey released a remix of the track featuring Juice WRLD.

description: “Colors” is about falling out of love with someone because they changed too much as a person.  The context behind family and addictions provides evidence that “Colors” is about The 1975’s frontman Matty Healy.  In October of 2015, Halsey mentioned during one of her shows that her and Matty met at that particular venue. She has also mentioned him as an inspiring influence. Billboard brought him up in an interview, questioning the nature of their relationship, to which she responded:  We’re both attracted to characters, and we saw that in each other. I spent a lot of time watching him and he spent a lot of time loving being watched. But if you think he’s the first red-wine-drinking, pretty-boy rocker in skinny jeans I’ve … been associated with, you’re out of your fucking mind.  Halsey posted images of Healy on her Instagram, as well as a personal post on her (now deleted) personal Tumblr in July of 2014 about her sentiments towards their relationship.  Despite the depth of information provided, the two are not explicitly confirmed to have been a legitimate couple. At the time, Halsey was in a relationship with Norwegian hip-hop artist and producer Lido, who worked extensively on many tracks from Badlands and went on to produce many songs in her discography.  “Colors” was the second single from Halsey’s debut Badlands, announced through a mural in Brooklyn, NY in January of 2016. The official music video features MTV’s Teen Wolf star Tyler Posey and tells a tale of unrequited love.
